events.text: The [13th](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1925_Grey_Cup) [Grey Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grey_Cup) of Canadian football was played. The [Ottawa Senators](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ottawa_Senators_(football)) beat the Winnipeg Tammany Tigers, 24 to 1.
The city of [Medina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medina) capitulated to the forces of [Ibn Saud](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ibn_Saud) without resistance.

[Peter Paul Rubens](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_Paul_Rubens)' portrait of Saint [Teresa of Ávila](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teresa_of_Ávila) was found in Berlin after being hidden for 200 years.
The heavily sensationalized [Kip Rhinelander](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kip_Rhinelander) divorce trial ended with the jury ruling in Mrs. Rhinelander's favour.

events.text: The Milner-Schialoja Agreement between the United Kingdom and Italy redrew the border between [Egypt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Egypt) and [Italian Libya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_Libya), transferring [Jaghbub](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jaghbub,_Libya) to Italian control.

The [Pottsville Maroons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pottsville_Maroons) defeated the [Chicago Cardinals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_the_Chicago_Cardinals) 21-7 to all but officially clinch the [National Football League championship](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1925_NFL_season) with the league's best record.

U.S. President [Calvin Coolidge](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Calvin_Coolidge) made his third [State of the Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/State_of_the_Union) address to the [Congress](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Congress), stating that "in the fundamentals of government and business the results demonstrate that we are going in the right direction. The country does not appear to require radical departures from the policies already adopted so much as it needs a further extension of these policies and the improvement of details."

The comedic stage musical *[The Cocoanuts](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Cocoanuts_(musical))*, written by [Irving Berlin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Irving_Berlin) for the [Marx Brothers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marx_Brothers), opened on Broadway.

events.text: The [Nobel Prizes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobel_Prize) for 1925 were awarded in [Oslo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oslo). The honourees consisted of [James Franck](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Franck) and [Gustav Hertz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gustav_Hertz) ([award for Physics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobel_Prize_in_Physics)), [Richard Adolf Zsigmondy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Adolf_Zsigmondy) ([Chemistry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobel_Prize_in_Chemistry)) and [George Bernard Shaw](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Bernard_Shaw) ([Literature](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobel_Prize_in_Literature)). There was no Prize for Medicine that year. The [Peace Prize](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobel_Peace_Prize) was not awarded at the time either; [Austen Chamberlain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Austen_Chamberlain) of the United Kingdom and [Charles G. Dawes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_G._Dawes) of the United States were named retroactively twelve months later for their roles in the [Locarno Treaties](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Locarno_Treaties) and the [Dawes Plan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dawes_Plan), respectively.

The [Chicago Cardinals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_the_Chicago_Cardinals) football team beat the [Milwaukee Badgers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Milwaukee_Badgers) 59-0 in a game that resulted in the [Chicago Cardinals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_the_Chicago_Cardinals)–[Milwaukee Badgers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Milwaukee_Badgers) scandal, because the Badgers team was composed of high school players that the Cardinals could easily beat in order to pad their win–loss percentage and claim the [NFL](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Football_League) championship.

sources: [The Nobel Peace Prize 1926](https://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/peace/laureates/1926/briand-acceptance.html)
[The Nobel Peace Prize 1925](https://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/peace/laureates/1925/)

events.text: [Pope Pius XI](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pope_Pius_XI) promulgated *[Quas primas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quas_primas)*, an encyclical introducing the [Feast of Christ the King](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Feast_of_Christ_the_King).

births.text: [Paul Greengard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_Greengard), neuroscientist and recipient of the [Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobel_Prize_in_Physiology_or_Medicine), in New York City (d. 2019)
**Married:** Karam and Kartari Chand were married in a Sikh ceremony in India, longest married living couple

events.text: The [Pottsville Maroons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pottsville_Maroons) football team played an exhibition game against the [Notre Dame Fighting Irish](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Notre_Dame_Fighting_Irish) in [Philadelphia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philadelphia), winning 9-7. This was the game that caused the [1925 NFL Championship controversy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1925_NFL_Championship_controversy) when [National Football League](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Football_League) President [Joseph Carr](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Carr) immediately suspended the Maroons and denied them the rights to the championship on the grounds that they had violated the territorial rights of the [Frankford Yellow Jackets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frankford_Yellow_Jackets).

The first [motel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/motel) in the world, the Milestone Mo-Tel (later the [Motel Inn](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Motel_Inn) of [San Luis Obispo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Luis_Obispo)), opened in [San Luis Obispo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Luis_Obispo), [California](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/California).
The [Chilean National Zoo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chilean_National_Zoo) opened.

events.text: Agent General for Reparations to Germany [Seymour Parker Gilbert](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seymour_Parker_Gilbert) released his first annual report in Berlin, announcing that Germany was making rapid advances in its industrial and economic health and was fulfilling all its [Dawes Plan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dawes_Plan) commitments to the last detail.

births.text: [Dick Van Dyke](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dick_Van_Dyke), entertainer, in [West Plains, Missouri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/West_Plains,_Missouri)

events.text: Pope Pius XI elevated four new cardinals: [Bonaventura Cerretti](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bonaventura_Cerretti), [Enrico Gasparri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enrico_Gasparri), Irishman [Patrick O'Donnell](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patrick_O'Donnell_(cardinal)) and [Alessandro Verde](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alessandro_Verde). He also made a speech that did not specifically mention [Mussolini](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benito_Mussolini) or [fascism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/fascism) by name but condemned "legislation which makes the state and not the church the center of social life."

The [League of Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/League_of_Nations) settled the border between Greece and Bulgaria and fined the Greek government for the border violation committed during the [Incident at Petrich](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Incident_at_Petrich).
Italy's Fascist government signs a secret pact with Britain aimed at reinforcing Italian dominance in [Ethiopia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethiopia).

births.text: [Sam Jones](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sam_Jones_(baseball)), baseball player, in Stewartsville, Ohio (d. 1971)

sources: Pope Condemns Mussolini Law; Road to Anarchy - December 15, 1925, p. 9, Author: Larry Rue

events.text: The War Ministry of Japan ordered 3,500 troops to [Manchuria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manchuria) to protect the South [Manchuria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manchuria) Railway and other Japanese interests around [Mukden](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shenyang) as the forces of [Guo Songling](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guo_Songling) advanced against [Zhang Zuolin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zhang_Zuolin).

A [League of Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/League_of_Nations) commission ruled on the [[Mosul](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mosul) Question](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/[Mosul](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mosul)_Question) by assigning most of the territory in the oil-rich [Mosul](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mosul) region to Iraq, despite strong Turkish objections.

[Reza Shah](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reza_Shah) took the oath to become the first [shah](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_monarchs_of_[Persia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Imperial_State_of_Iran)) of [Persia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Imperial_State_of_Iran) of the [Pahlavi dynasty](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pahlavi_dynasty).

The third version of [Madison Square Garden](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Madison_Square_Garden_(1925)) opened in New York City. The first official event was the [New York Americans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_Americans) hockey team playing their first ever home game, losing 3-1 to the [Montreal Canadiens](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Montreal_Canadiens).
The film *[The Plastic Age](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Plastic_Age_(film))* opened.

deaths.text: **Died:** [Battling Siki](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battling_Siki), 28, American-Senegalese boxer (shot)

events.text: The [Italianization of South Tyrol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italianization_of_South_Tyrol) became a contentious subject between Italy and Germany as a newspaper run by [Gustav Stresemann](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gustav_Stresemann) ran an editorial protesting an Italian decree banning [Christmas trees](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christmas_tree). "Have the most influential of the Italian politicians been abandoned by their God or their common sense, or have they without exception gone mad with their Fascist megalomania. For this newest deed can only be described as that of a crazy person", the editorial declared.
[Alpha Phi Omega](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alpha_Phi_Omega), a national service fraternity, was founded at [Lafayette College](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lafayette_College) in Pennsylvania.
[Colombo Radio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colombo_Radio) launched in Ceylon; the station subsequently became known as *[Radio Ceylon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Radio_Ceylon)*.
The werewolf film *[Wolf Blood](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wolf_Blood)* was released in the United States.

sources: Italy's Ban on Christmas Tree Angers Germany - December 17, 1925, p. 15, Author: John Clayton

events.text: The [court-martial](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/court-martial) of Col. [Billy Mitchell](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Mitchell) (U.S. Army) ended when he was convicted on all eight charges of insubordination. Mitchell was suspended without pay for five years, a verdict the court ruled was "lenient because of the military record of the accused during the [world war](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_I)."
The [Siege of Jeddah](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Jeddah_(1925)) ended in victory for [Ibn Saud](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ibn_Saud).
Turkey and the Soviet Union signed a security pact.
[Natacha Rambova](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Natacha_Rambova) filed for divorce from [Rudolph Valentino](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rudolph_Valentino) in Paris court.

[António Maria da Silva](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/António_Maria_da_Silva) became [Prime Minister of Portugal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Portugal) for the fourth time.

Brainard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Legge_Brainard) were among the honorees.

[Nomura Securities](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nomura_Securities) was founded in [Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan), a separate section from Osaka Nomura Bank. (currently [Resona Holdings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Resona_Holdings))
Six chemical companies in Germany merged to form [IG Farben](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IG_Farben).

events.text: [White Hand Gang](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/White_Hand_Gang) leader [Richard "Pegleg" Lonergan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Lonergan) arrived at a Christmas party in a Brooklyn [speakeasy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/speakeasy) with five of his men around 3 a.m., intoxicated and uttering various racial slurs. The lights went out, shots were fired and patrons ran out in a panic. When the lights came back on, Lonergan and two of his men lay dead. [Al Capone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al_Capone) was in the club while on a visit to New York and had arranged the hit at the request of [Frankie Yale](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frankie_Yale); the ambush further enhanced Capone's notoriety.
The [Communist Party of India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Communist_Party_of_India) was founded.

events.text: The first attempt at a worldwide New Year's celebration was made via international radio. The United States sent out musical entertainment and New Year's greetings from the [consuls general](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/consul_general) of various foreign countries in New York. Evening listeners for participating stations across the United States heard a radio announcer in London say, "This is [2LO](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2LO) calling America and sending New Year's greetings. We have received word that the American stations are broadcasting this program and we hope that it is being relayed successfully."

The Australian state of [Western Australia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Western_Australia) held a [referendum on prohibition](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1925_Western_Australian_prohibition_referendum). The proposal for prohibition was defeated.

Subsequent research has established that this was actually not the first, as the earliest known [in-flight movie](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/in-flight_entertainment) has been dated to 1921.

events.text: The [Dawes Plan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dawes_Plan), a restructuring of the payment of [reparations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_reparations) owed by Germany to the victorious Allied Powers of World War I, went into effect, three days after it was approved by Germany.

The [Russian All-Military Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_All-Military_Union), composed of remaining members of the [White Russian Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/White_Army) that had failed in its attempt to prevent the Communist "Red Army" from controlling Russia, was founded in Yugoslavia by General [Pyotr Wrangel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pyotr_Wrangel) in the Serbian town of [Sremski Karlovci](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sremski_Karlovci).

[Joe Boyer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_Boyer), who had won the [1924 Indianapolis 500](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1924_Indianapolis_500) in May, was fatally injured at the infamous [Altoona Speedway](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Altoona_Speedway) in [Altoona, Pennsylvania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Altoona,_Pennsylvania), after crashing through the rail while attempting to take the lead in the Altoona 250. A year before, the [Altoona Speedway](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Altoona_Speedway) 250 race had claimed the life of 1919 Indianapolis winner [Howdy Wilcox](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Howdy_Wilcox).
A hurricane that had stricken the [Virgin Islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virgin_Islands) on August 28 eased, after having killed at least 80 people.
The film *[The Side Show of Life](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Side_Show_of_Life)*, starring [Ernest Torrence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ernest_Torrence), was released.

events.text: The [[Taif](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taif) massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/[Taif](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taif)_massacre) of at least 300 civilians was carried out in the Kingdom of Hejaz at the city of [Taif](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taif), near [Mecca](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mecca), by troops of the [Ikhwan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ikhwan), sent by Sultan Ibn Saud of Nejd in the course of the [Saudi conquest of Hejaz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_conquest_of_Hejaz).

The "[Ruido de sables](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ruido_de_sables)" (rattling of sabers) incident took place in [Chile](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chile) when a group of 56 young military officers, led by Colonel [Marmaduke Grove](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marmaduke_Grove), loudly rattled their ceremonial sabers within their scabbards in a political protest after they were asked to leave the Chamber of Deputies, which debating military benefits. "[Ruido de sables](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ruido_de_sables)" became a metaphor in Spanish-speaking nations for a military conspiracy to plot a coup d'état. The event was part of the young officers' response to the Chamber's failure to enact the proposed reforms of President [Arturo Alessandri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arturo_Alessandri).

Chinese warlord [Qi Xieyuan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qi_Xieyuan) (referred to in the Western press during his lifetime as Ch'i Hsieh-yuan), governor of the [Jiangsu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jiangsu) province, went to war against [Lu Yongxiang](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lu_Yongxiang_(warlord)) (Lu Yung-hsiang), military governor of the [Zhejiang](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zhejiang) province, beginning the Jiangzu-[Zhejiang](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zhejiang) War within China.

On the second lap, he suffered a blowout and crashed through a corrugated iron fence.

events.text: British Prime Minister [Ramsay MacDonald](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ramsay_MacDonald) made a frank speech to the [League of Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/League_of_Nations) Assembly in [Geneva](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geneva), essentially ending further discussion on the proposed ["Treaty of Mutual Guarantee"](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom_and_the_League_of_Nations) that would replace existing national armies with an international armed force. MacDonald said that history had demonstrated that military alliances were no guarantor of security, and that to provide security, Germany and Russia must be admitted to the League. He added, "If we cannot devise proper arbitration let us go back to competitive armaments and military pacts and prepare for the inevitable next war." As to representatives of small nations he said, "Pact or no pact, you will be invaded, devastated and crushed. You are certain to be the victims of the military age."

[Max Huber](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Max_Huber_(statesman)) was elected as the second president of the [Permanent Court of International Justice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Permanent_Court_of_International_Justice), commonly called the "World Court" and an attachment to the [League of Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/League_of_Nations).

events.text: The [Trades Union Congress](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trades_Union_Congress) at [Hull](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kingston_upon_Hull) in England voted to take industrial action to stop war if necessary.

The three remaining planes of the American [round-the-world flyers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/First_aerial_circumnavigation) (*Chicago*, *New Orleans* and *Boston II*) and their two-member crews returned to U.S. airspace and landed near [Brunswick, Maine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brunswick,_Maine) in a dense fog. To complete their journey, they were still required to return to [Seattle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seattle).

The same officers who had carried out the "[ruido de sables](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ruido_de_sables)" in [Chile](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chile) on September 3, led by Colonel Marmaduke Grove, entered the office of President Arturo Alessandri and demanded that he dismiss his Interior Minister, as well as to have him pressure the Congtress to enact a labor code, a reformed income tax law, and the raising military salaries. Faced with his overthrow, President Alessandri complied with Grove's demands and appointed General [Luis Altamirano](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luis_Altamirano) as the new Minister of the Interior.

[Evgen Gvaladze](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evgen_Gvaladze), who had attempted an armed rebellion in the Georgian SSR, was arrested by Soviet authorities. Gvaladze was released in March as part of a general amnesty for political prisoners.

events.text: The fourth annual [Miss America Pageant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miss_America_1924) was held at [Atlantic City, New Jersey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atlantic_City,_New_Jersey) and won by Miss Philadelphia, [Ruth Malcomson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ruth_Malcomson) (1906—1988). The 1922 and 1923 winner, [Mary Katherine Campbell](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mary_Katherine_Campbell) (who had entered from Ohio as Miss Columbus), placed First Runner-Up. The pageant marked the last time that previous winners were eligible to enter the Miss America pageant.

[Chicago](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chicago)'s new [Soldier Field](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soldier_Field), referred to at the time as the Grant Park Stadium, held its first public event, admitting 45,000 paying customers to watch the two-day Police Athletic Games, a fundraiser for the [Chicago](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chicago) Police Benevolent Association. Events included a [chariot race](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/chariot_race) and a game of [motorcycle polo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/motorcycle_polo).

[John Dillinger](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Dillinger) made his first attempt at a major crime when he and a friend attempted to rob a grocery store in [Mooresville, Indiana](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mooresville,_Indiana). The two were shortly apprehended and sent to jail.

events.text: The [Hanapepe massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hanapepe_massacre), a gun battle in the U.S. Territory of [Hawaii](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hawaii), killed 20 people, most of them striking Filipino workers at the McBryde sugar plantation on the island of [Kauai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kauai). After two strikebreakers were taken hostage by armed members of the Higher Wage Movement, [Kauai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kauai) County police intervened. When the fighting ended, four police officers and 16 plantation workers were dead. Afterward, 130 Filipino workers were arrested, 56 of whom received jail sentences, and many of whom were deported back to the Philippines.

Combat troops from the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Marine_Corps), Great Britain, Japan and Italy were deployed in [Shanghai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shanghai) to protect their nations' interests as civil war appeared imminent in China.

The [[Kohat](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kohat) Riots](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1924_[Kohat](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kohat)_riots), three days of fighting between [Muslims](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islam) against the minority [Hindus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hinduism) and [Sikhs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sikhism), began in the town of [Kohat](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kohat) in the [North-West Frontier Province](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North-West_Frontier_Province) of [British India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/British_India) (now the [Khyber Pakhtunkhwa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khyber_Pakhtunkhwa) province of [Pakistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pakistan). After the evacuation of most of the town's 8,000 [Hindus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hinduism) and [Sikhs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sikhism) to [Rawalpindi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rawalpindi), 12 [Hindus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hinduism) were dead and 13 others missing, and 11 [Muslims](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islam) were confirmed to be killed.
The [League of Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/League_of_Nations) began drafting a plan to take over the supervision of Germany's disarmament.

President [Calvin Coolidge](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Calvin_Coolidge) waited for four hours in the rain to greet the [round-the-world flyers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/First_aerial_circumnavigation) at [Bolling Field](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joint_Base_Anacostia–Bolling) in Washington, D.C.

events.text: The [Leopold and Loeb](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leopold_and_Loeb) trial ended with a sentence of imprisonment for "life plus 99 years" for both Nathan F. Leopold Jr. and Richard Albert Loeb for the May 21 kidnapping and murder of Bobby Franks, instead of the death penalty the state had sought. Loeb would remain at the Illinois State Penitentiary in [Joliet, Illinois](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joliet,_Illinois) for the rest of his life, serving a little more than 11 years until being killed by another inmate on January 28, 1936. Leopold lived almost 13 more years, dying of a diabetes-related heart attack on August 29, 1971.

events.text: Following the forced resignation of Chile's President [Arturo Alessandri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arturo_Alessandri), the three-member "[September Junta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_Junta_of_Chile_(1924))", led by General [Luis Altamirano](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luis_Altamirano), took over the administration of the South American republic, along with Admiral [Francisco Nef](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Francisco_Nef) and General [Juan Pablo Bennett](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juan_Pablo_Bennett). The junta's rule would last only four months before a counter-coup on January 23, 1925.

At the age of 11, [Pengiran Ahmad Tajuddin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ahmad_Tajuddin) became the new [Sultan of Brunei](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_sultans_of_Brunei) (at the time a British protectorate) upon the death of his father, the Sultan Jamalul Alam II.

In Italy, [[Armando Casalini](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/:it:Armando_Casalini)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/:it:Armando_Casalini), a Fascist Party member of the Italian Chamber of Deputies, was assassinated by a Communist activist, [Giovanni Corvi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/:it:Giovanni_Corvi) killed the fascist deputy [[Armando Casalini](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/:it:Armando_Casalini)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/:it:Armando_Casalini) to avenge the June 12 assassination of Socialist Party deputy [Giacomo Matteotti](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Giacomo_Matteotti). The shooting, combined with the [June 26 walkout of opposition deputies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aventine_Secession_(20th_century)), would serve as a pretext for a Fascist position.
The [Nestorian rebellion](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nestorian_rebellion), a second uprising by the [Assyrian people](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assyrian_people) in southeastern Turkey, began.

events.text: A [6.8 magnitude earthquake](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1924_[Pasinler](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pasinler)_earthquake) killed 60 people in and around the city of [Pasinler](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pasinler) in northeastern [Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey).

[General of the Armies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/General_of_the_Armies) [John J. Pershing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_J._Pershing), the last American military officer to achieve the rank of a six-star general, and the Chief of Staff of the U.S. Army since 1921, retired from the United States Army upon reaching the age of 64 (as required by Department of War regulations at the time) and was granted full pay and allowances for the rest of his life, as well as continued use of his office at the [SWAN Building](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eisenhower_Executive_Office_Building) in Washington that served as the headquarters of the Department of State, the Department of War and the Department of the Navy. Pershing was succeeded as Army Chief of Staff by Major General [John L. Hines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_L._Hines).

French general [Jean Degoutte](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jean_Degoutte) allowed all functionaries and other public employees ousted or deported from the [Ruhr](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ruhr) since [the occupation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/occupation_of_the_Ruhr) began to return to work.

The [1924 International Lawn Tennis Challenge](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1924_International_Lawn_Tennis_Challenge), now called the [Davis Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Davis_Cup), which started in May with challengers from 22 nations, finished with the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Davis_Cup_team) (Bill Tilden defeating [Australia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australia_Davis_Cup_team) in all five matches.

The [hoax](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/hoax) of the "[Tucson artifacts](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tucson_artifacts)" began as a family in the U.S. state of [Arizona](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arizona) reported finding the first of 31 lead objects, including swords, crosses and ceremonial objects with dates written upon them in Roman numerals, corresponding to the years ranging from 47 A.D. to 157 A.D., with an inscription on object that seemed to be evidence of settlers who had come to North America from the Roman Empire, founding a settlement called "Calalus".

births.text: [Maurice Jarre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maurice_Jarre), French composer known primarily for his creation of film scores for major motion pictures including *[Lawrence of Arabia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lawrence_of_Arabia_(film))* (1962) and *[Ghost](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ghost_(1990_film))* (1990) winner of four Golden Globes and a Grammy Award; in [Lyon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lyon)(d. 2009)

[Douglas Gamley](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Douglas_Gamley), Australian composer known for the film scores for Australian, British and American films including *[Tom Thumb](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom_Thumb_(film))* (1958) and *[The Land That Time Forgot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Land_That_Time_Forgot_(1974_film))* (1974); in [Melbourne](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Melbourne) (d. 1998)

[Ruth Jean Baskerville Bowen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ruth_Jean_Baskerville_Bowen), the first female African-American [talent agent](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/talent_agent); in [Danville, Virginia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Danville,_Virginia) (d. 2009)

deaths.text: **Died:** [Bhupendra Nath Bose](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bhupendra_Nath_Bose), 65, Indian politician who served in the [Bengal Legislative Assembly](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bengal_Legislative_Assembly) from 1904 to 1910, and later as President of the [Indian National Congress](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indian_National_Congress) during the year 1914

sources: France Permits Ruhr Officials to Resume Jobs - September 14, 1924, p. 23

events.text: A [helicopter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/helicopter) designed by [Étienne Oehmichen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Étienne_Oehmichen) lifted a 400-pound cargo 1 meter and 10 centimeters off the ground, winning a prize offered by the French government.

In the [championship game](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1923_All-Ireland_Senior_Hurling_Championship) of the highest level of competition in the [Gaelic Athletic Association](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaelic_Athletic_Association) in the sport of [hurling](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/hurling), the inter-county tournament, [Galway GAA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Galway_GAA) defeated [Limerick GAA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Limerick_GAA), 7–3 to 4–5, equivalent to a 24 to 17 win based on three-point goals and single points for scores above the goal post.

[High Point University](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/High_Point_University), which would celebrate its 100th year in 2023 and 2024, opened as High Point College. Located in the town of [High Point, North Carolina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/High_Point,_North_Carolina), the private Methodist college had an initial enrollment of 122 students, taught by nine faculty members. It would be redesignated as a university in 1991 upon offering a master's degree program.

The [lost film](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/lost_film) *[The Alaskan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Alaskan)*, a Paramount studios movie starring [Thomas Meighan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_Meighan), [Estelle Taylor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Estelle_Taylor) and [Anna Mae Wong](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anna_Mae_Wong) premiered in New York City. The production was filmed on location in the U.S. [Territory of Alaska](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Territory_of_Alaska), and the Chinese-born Miss Wong played the role of an [Eskimo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eskimo).

births.text: [Davidson Nicol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Davidson_Nicol), [[Sierra Leone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sierra_Leone)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sierra_Leone) physician and diabetes researcher known for his discoveries in analyzing the breakdown of insulin in the human body, as wells as being [[Sierra Leone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sierra_Leone)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sierra_Leone)'s first ambassador to the United Nations (1969 to 1971); in [Freetown](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freetown), [[Sierra Leone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sierra_Leone)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sierra_Leone) (d. 1994)

events.text: The [Second Zhili–Fengtian War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Second_Zhili–Fengtian_War) began in northeastern China between the Japanese-supported Manchurian forces led by [Zhang Zuolin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zhang_Zuolin) in the [Fengtian Province](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fengtian_Province) (now [Liaoning](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liaoning) province), attacking the city of Ch'in-Huang-Tao ([Qinhuangdao](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qinhuangdao)) in the [Zhili province](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zhili_province) (now [Hebei](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hebei) province) led by [Wu Peifu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wu_Peifu). After six weeks, the war was over with Zhang's forces having taken control of [Zhili province](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zhili_province), along with Jiangsu, Jiangxi and Hubei provinces.

The [Saks Fifth Avenue](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saks_Fifth_Avenue) luxury department store was opened by [Horace Saks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andrew_Saks) and [Bernard Gimbel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bernard_Gimbel) at the newly completed Saks building at 611 Fifth Avenue.

German astronomer [Friedrich Simon Archenhold](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Friedrich_Simon_Archenhold) said that he saw what he believed to be an attempt by inhabitants of [Mars](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mars) to contact Earth. "I cannot disclose everything I saw", Archenhold stated. "I am a scientist and I am not seeking newspaper sensations, but this much I will say – I was thunderstruck by what I saw. I could not believe my eyes. I thought perhaps my sons had climbed on the observatory roof and had planted something in the telescope, but it was not so. I am now going to [Jungfrau](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jungfrau), [Milan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Milan), and other observatories to discuss my findings with other scientists seeking an answer to the question of whether there is life on [Mars](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mars)."
The German government decided to postpone any attempt to join the [League of Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/League_of_Nations) until the next year.

The [round-the-world flyers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/First_aerial_circumnavigation) arrived in [Chicago](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chicago), conducting a fly-over of the city escorted by a dozen army planes.

births.text: [Bobby Short](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bobby_Short), cabaret singer and pianist, in [Danville, Illinois](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Danville,_Illinois) (d. 2005)

deaths.text: **Died:** [Frank Chance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Chance), 48, American baseball player immortalized (along with [Joe Tinker](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_Tinker) and [Johnny Evers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Johnny_Evers)) in the phrase "Tinker-to-Evers-to-Chance" in the [Franklin Pierce Adams](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franklin_Pierce_Adams) poem [Baseball's Sad Lexicon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baseball's_Sad_Lexicon)", later an inductee in the [Baseball Hall of Fame](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baseball_Hall_of_Fame)

[Bhichai Rattakul](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bhichai_Rattakul), Deputy Prime Minister of Thailand, 1983 to 1990 and 1997 to 2000, later the World President of the service club [Rotary International](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rotary_International), 2002–2004; in [Bangkok](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bangkok), [Kingdom of Siam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rattanakosin_Kingdom_(1782–1932)) (d.2022)

events.text: [Julian Byng](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Julian_Byng,_1st_Viscount_Byng_of_Vimy), the [Governor-General of Canada](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Governor-General_of_Canada), issued an order mandating the termination of the [Six Nations Confederacy Council](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Six_Nations_of_the_Grand_River) of the [Iroquois](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iroquois), made up of the hereditary chiefs for the [Mohawk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mohawk_people), [Cayuga](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cayuga_people_), [Onondaga](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Onondaga_people), [Oneida](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oneida_people), [Seneca](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seneca_people) and [Tuscarora](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tuscarora_people) tribes within the Six Nations [Reserve](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indian_reserve) in the province of [Ontario](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ontario).  Pursuant to Canada's [Indian Act](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indian_Act), Viscount Byng directed that the Six Nations Council be replaced by an elective body. The decision came after the [Iroquois](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iroquois) Confederacy Chief [Deskaheh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deskaheh) had attempted to bring concerns of the Six Nations to the attention of the [League of Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/League_of_Nations).

[Poland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Second_Polish_Republic)'s [Border Protection Corps](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Border_Protection_Corps) (*Korpus Ochrony Pogranicza* or KOP) was created to protect the nation's eastern boundaries from potential invasion by the Soviet Union and from bandits crossing the border from the U.S., with six battalions and five regiments.

The generation of power from the [Skagit River Hydroelectric Project](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skagit_River_Hydroelectric_Project), in the U.S. state of [Washington](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Washington_(state)), was in a ceremony with a signal from U.S. President Calvin Coolidge, who was at his desk in the White House at [Washington](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Washington_(state)), DC.

[Prince Wolfgang of Hesse](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_Wolfgang_of_Hesse) married [Princess Marie Alexandra of Baden](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Princess_Marie_Alexandra_of_Baden) over the objections of Wolfgang's uncle, the former German Kaiser [Wilhelm II](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wilhelm_II,_German_Emperor).

events.text: The U.S. [military occupation of the Dominican Republic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_occupation_of_the_Dominican_Republic_(1916–1924)) came to an end after more than eight years. Since May 5, 1916, when the U.S. Marines had arrived to maintain order while the Caribbean nation's customs revenues were take control of by the American government in order for the Dominican Republic to pay its debts. Upon completing its withdrawal after three months, the U.S. Marines turned over police power to the Dominican Republic National Police Force.
The [Mahatma Gandhi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mahatma_Gandhi) began a 21-day fast of despair over the [recent riots](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1924_Kohat_riots) between Hindus and Muslims.

births.text: [Jean Lindenmann](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jean_Lindenmann), Yugoslavia-born Swiss immunologist and co-discoverer (with [Alick Isaacs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alick_Isaacs)) of [interferon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/interferon); in [Zagreb](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zagreb) (d.2015)

[Neville Chittick](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neville_Chittick), British archaeologist; in [Hove](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hove), [East Sussex](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/East_Sussex) (d. 1984)

[Bob C. Riley](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_C._Riley), U.S. politician who was the first [blind](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/blindness) person to serve as the governor of a U.S. state; in [Little Rock, Arkansas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Little_Rock,_Arkansas). From January 3 to January 12, 1974, Riley, who had lost his sight when he was wounded in World War II, and who been Lieutenant Governor since 1971, served as [Governor of Arkansas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Governor_of_Arkansas) for the remainder of the term of [Dale Bumpers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dale_Bumpers), who had resigned on January 3 to be sworn in as a U.S. Senator.

deaths.text: **Died:** [George Walker](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Walker_(South_Africa)), English-born South African prospector who discovered the gold deposits of [Witwatersrand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Witwatersrand) in 1886, but received no credit for his discovery, died in poverty at the age of 71.

events.text: [Alexander Krasnoshchyokov](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexander_Krasnoshchyokov), Soviet Communist politician and the former party leader in the [Far Eastern Republic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Far_Eastern_Republic), became the first prominent Bolshevik and ally of the late [Vladimir Lenin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vladimir_Lenin) to be arrested by the government on order of [Joseph Stalin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Stalin). Convicted on charges of corruption, Krasnoshchyokov would be released four months later and be allowed to rejoin the Soviet government in the autumn of 1925, though eventually losing favor again with Stalin and being executed in 1937.

The [[Bukhara](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bukhara) People's Soviet Republic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/[Bukhara](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bukhara)_People's_Soviet_Republic), with a capital at [Bukhara](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bukhara), was established by Uzbek, Tajik and Russian Communists in what is now [Uzbekistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uzbekistan), and applied to be admitted to the Soviet Union. It would exist for less than six weeks.

[Suchitra Mitra](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suchitra_Mitra), Indian singer, in Gujhandi, [Bengal Province](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bengal_Presidency) [British India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/British_Raj) (now in the state of [Bihar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bihar)) (d. 2011)

events.text: A [secret agreement was made](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sino-Soviet_conflict_(1929)) by the [Republic of China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republic_of_China_(1912–1949)) and the [Soviet Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_Union), following up on an equally-secret protocol on March 14. The Chinese had made a bargain with the Soviets that all former conventions, treaties, protocols, contracts, and documents between the Soviet and China would be annulled until a conference could convene between the two nations.

[Chicago Cubs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chicago_Cubs) pitcher [Grover Cleveland Alexander](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grover_Cleveland_Alexander) won the [300th game](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/300_win_club) of his career, pitching all 12 innings of a 7–3 win over the [New York Giants](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_the_New_York_Giants_(NL)).
The [Nuns of the Battlefield](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuns_of_the_Battlefield) monument by [Jerome Connor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jerome_Connor) was dedicated in Washington, D.C.

events.text: The **[Autostrada](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Autostrada_A9_(Italy))**, the world's first [divided highway](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/dual_carriageway), opened to motor traffic in Italy. An improvement to existing [limited-access roads](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/limited-access_road), the **[Autostrada](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Autostrada_A9_(Italy))** had only one lane in each direction and no exits along its high-speed 42.6 km route between [Milan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Milan) and [Varese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Varese).

[Three days of voting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1924_Swedish_general_election) concluded for the 230 seats of the lower house (*andra kammares*) of the [Riksdag](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riksdag). The [Social Democrat Workers Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swedish_Social_Democratic_Party) (*Socialdemokratiska arbetareparti*), led by former Prime Minister [Hjalmar Branting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hjalmar_Branting), increased its plurality to 104 seats, still 12 short of a majority.

Spanish Army Lieutenant Colonel [Francisco Franco](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Francisco_Franco), angry with the plans of Prime Minister [Miguel Primo de Rivera](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miguel_Primo_de_Rivera) to pull back troops fighting the [Rif War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rif_War) in [Morocco](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morocco), approached General [Gonzalo Queipo de Llano](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gonzalo_Queipo_de_Llano) and proposed that General Queipo lead a coup d'état to overthrow the premier. The General declined the suggestion, and Franco postponed his plans to lead a right-wing revolution against the Spanish government.

U.S. President [Calvin Coolidge](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Calvin_Coolidge) condemned [socialism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/socialism) in a speech in [Washington](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Washington,_D.C.) made during the closing exercises of a convention of the [Society of the Holy Name](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Society_of_the_Holy_Name). "Socialism and communism cannot be reconciled with the principles which our institutions represent", Coolidge said in a statement interpreted as a criticism of rival presidential candidate [Robert M. La Follette](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_M._La_Follette,_Sr.). "They are entirely foreign, entirely un-American. We stand wholly committed to the policy that what the individual produces belongs entirely to him to be used to the benefit of himself, to provide for his own family and to enable him to serve his fellow man."
The action film *[Roaring Rails](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roaring_Rails)*, starring [Harry Carey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_Carey_(actor)), was released.
The rugby union club [FC Barcelona Rugby](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FC_Barcelona_Rugby) was formed in Spain.

events.text: The [Woolworths Group](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Woolworths_Group_(Australia)) of Australia (unrelated to the [F. W. Woolworth Company](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/F._W._Woolworth_Company) chain of [five-and-dime](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/five-and-dime) stores in the U.S. and the UK), owner of the [Woolworths Supermarkets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Woolworths_Supermarkets) grocery store chain and the [Big W](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Big_W) department stores, was founded in [Sydney](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sydney) by five entrepreneurs. It opened its first "Woolworths Stupendous Bargain Basement" on December 5.

The sinking of the American freighter SS *Clifton* in [Lake Huron](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lake_Huron) drowned all 26 of its crew. The ship had departed [Sturgeon Bay, Wisconsin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sturgeon_Bay,_Wisconsin), the day before with a cargo of crushed stone, bound for [Detroit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Detroit) . Its wreckage would be found more than 90 years later in [2016](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2016).

In an unprecedented [three-cushion billiards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/three-cushion_billiards) match between the world champions of [balkline](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/balkline) ([Willie Hoppe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Willie_Hoppe)) and [straight pool](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/straight_pool) ([Ralph Greenleaf](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ralph_Greenleaf)), both of the U.S., Hoppe won, 600 to 527.

In [Vienna](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vienna), the first public performance was made of "[Piano Concerto for the Left Hand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Piano_Concerto_for_the_Left_Hand_(Korngold))", written by [Erich Wolfgang Korngold](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erich_Wolfgang_Korngold). Austrian pianist [Paul Wittgenstein](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_Wittgenstein), who had lost his left arm during World War I, commissioned the writing of the three-section piece and gave its first public performance.

The 19-story [Roosevelt Hotel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Roosevelt_Hotel_([Manhattan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manhattan))) opened in 45 East 45th Street in [Manhattan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manhattan). Located near [Grand Central Station](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grand_Central_Terminal) had 1,025 rooms, as well as services such as child care, a kennel, and an in-house physician.

births.text: [Rosamunde Pilcher](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rosamunde_Pilcher), Cornish British novelist known for her bestseller *[The Shell Seekers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Shell_Seekers)*; she also wrote under the pen name Jane Fraser; in [Lelant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lelant), [Cornwall](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cornwall) (d. 2019)

[Gerald Schoenfeld](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gerald_Schoenfeld), U.S. theater owner and chairman of the [Shubert Organization](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shubert_Organization) and its 17 Broadway theaters; in New York City (d. 2008)

[Norvel Lee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norvel_Lee), African-American light heavyweight boxer and [Tuskegee Airman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tuskegee_Airman), and 1952 Olympic gold medalist; in [Eagle Rock, Virginia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eagle_Rock,_Virginia) (d.1992)
[Charles Keeping](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Keeping), English illustrator and author; in [Lambeth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lambeth), London (d. 1988)

events.text: [Voting was held in Denmark](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1924_Danish_Landsting_election) for 28 of the 76 seats of the *[Landstinget](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Landstinget)*, the upper house of the nation's parliament, the *[Rigsdag](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rigsdag)*. While [Venstre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venstre_(Denmark)) retained a plurality (31 seats) after the vote, and the [Socialdemokratiet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Social_Democrats_(Denmark)) of Prime Minister [Thorvald Stauning](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thorvald_Stauning) were in second place, Stauning's party retained control of the lower house, the *Folketing*, which elections had been held for on April 11.

The German cabinet announced its decision to work towards entering the [League of Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/League_of_Nations) as "a great power having equal rights with other great powers."

The [Court Treatt Expedition](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stella_Court_Treatt) began in [Cape Town](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cape_Town) (in [South Africa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Africa)) as an attempt by British Army Major Court Treatt and his wife Stella to drive across Africa to [Cairo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cairo) (in [Egypt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Egypt)). The group would succeed in the trip of more than 7000 mi, arriving in [Cairo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cairo) on January 24, 1926.

births.text: [Fereydoon Hoveyda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fereydoon_Hoveyda), the last ambassador to the United Nations for the Kingdom of Iran; in [Damascus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Damascus), [Mandate for Syria and the Lebanon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mandate_for_Syria_and_the_Lebanon) (d. 2006)

[Aroti Dutt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aroti_Dutt), Indian social worker and women's rights advocate who served as president of the [Associated Country Women of the World](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Associated_Country_Women_of_the_World) organization from 1965 to 1971; in [Calcutta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Calcutta) (d.2003)

events.text: British racer [Malcolm Campbell](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malcolm_Campbell) broke the record for fastest speed on land, driving "Blue Bird", a [Sunbeam 350HP](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sunbeam_350HP) with a V12 engine, at 146.18 mph at Pendine Sands. Campbell edged the records set in July by [Ernest Eldridge](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ernest_Eldridge) (145.89 mph on July 12) and [René Thomas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/René_Thomas_(racing_driver)) (143.31 mph on July 6).

The Indian civil rights organization [Samata Sainik Dal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samata_Sainik_Dal), which began its 100th year in 2023, was founded by [B. R. Ambedkar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/B._R._Ambedkar) with a mission of "safeguarding the rights of all oppressed sections of Indian society."

The Tamil language newspaper **[Tamil Nesan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tamil_Nesan)** published its first issue. Aimed at ethnic Indians in British Malaya, and later for Malaysia, **[Tamil Nesan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tamil_Nesan)** was notable for its duration. It would continue for more than 74 years before ceasing publication in 2019.

Sculptor [Gutzon Borglum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gutzon_Borglum) arrived in the U.S. state of South Dakota at the invitation of [Doane Robinson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doane_Robinson) to carry out plans to carve a statue of four American presidents in the state's [Black Hills](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Hills_National_Forest). Borglum's first choice of sites was the 150 ft tall granite pillars known as [The Needles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Needles_(Black_Hills)), but soon decided that the eroding, fragile rock formation could not support carving. After considering, and rejecting, [Black Elk Peak](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Elk_Peak), Borglum would eventually settle on [Mount Rushmore](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mount_Rushmore).

[Dazzy Vance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dazzy_Vance) of the [Brooklyn Robins](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1924_Brooklyn_Robins_season) became only the sixth pitcher in major-league history to throw an [immaculate inning](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/immaculate_inning), striking out all three batters on nine total pitches in the third inning of a 6–5 win over the [Chicago Cubs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chicago_Cubs).

The experimental short film *[Ballet Mécanique](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ballet_Mécanique)*, directed by [Fernand Léger](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fernand_Léger) and [Dudley Murphy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dudley_Murphy) with a musical score by [George Antheil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Antheil), premiered in [Vienna](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vienna).

events.text: English motorist [Malcolm Campbell](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malcolm_Campbell) set a new land speed record at [Pendine Sands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pendine_Sands) in [Wales](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wales) with a speed of 146.16 mph (235.22 km/h) in a [Sunbeam 350HP](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sunbeam_350HP).

The five-story tall [Leifeng Pagoda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leifeng_Pagoda) at [Hangzhou](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hangzhou) in [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China) collapsed suddenly, almost 950 years after its completion in the year [975](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/975). In [1999](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1999), building of an identical [pagoda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/pagoda) on the ruins of the old one would begin, opening on October 25, 2002.

Bardhan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A._B._Bardhan) (Arhendu Bhushan Bardhan), Indian trade union leader and former General Secretary of the [Communist Party of India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Communist_Party_of_India) (1996 to 2012); in [Barisal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barisal), [Bengal Presidency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bengal_Presidency), [British India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/British_India) (now [Bangladesh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bangladesh)) (d. 2016)

events.text: The [Delhi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Delhi) newspaper *[Hindustan Times](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hindustan_Times)*, the second-highest circulating [English language](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/English_language) newspaper in [India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/India) and the first to be owned by an [India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/India)n family, published its first issue. The paper was founded by independence activist [Sunder Singh Lyallpuri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sunder_Singh_Lyallpuri), a leader of the [Akali movement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Akali_movement).
Flooding killed 30 people in [Leningrad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/St._Petersburg).

Spanish Army General [Joaquín Milans del Bosch](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joaquín_Milans_del_Bosch), the former [Captain General of [Catalonia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catalonia)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captain_General_of_[Catalonia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catalonia)) by was appointed as the Civil Governor of [Barcelona](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barcelona) by Prime Minister [Miguel Primo de Rivera](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miguel_Primo_de_Rivera), and began a campaign against the ethnic [Catalan ethnic group](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catalan_language) within [Catalonia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catalonia).

births.text: [Jean Hoerni](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jean_Hoerni), Swiss-born electrical engineer who helped in the development of the [transistor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/transistor), and co-founded the [Fairchild Semiconductor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fairchild_Semiconductor) company; in [Geneva](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geneva) (d.1997)
[Ozzie Cadena](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ozzie_Cadena), American record producer; in [Oklahoma City, Oklahoma](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oklahoma_City,_Oklahoma) (d. 2008)

deaths.text: [Andrew Preston](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andrew_Preston_(businessman)), American businessman and fruit seller who co-founded the [Boston Fruit Company](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boston_Fruit_Company) and later the [United Fruit Company](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Fruit_Company), and popularized the [banana](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/banana) in the United States

[Walter Long, 1st Viscount Long](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Long,_1st_Viscount_Long), 70, British politician who served as [Secretary of State for the Colonies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secretary_of_State_for_the_Colonies) 1916–1919, and [First Lord of the Admiralty](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/First_Lord_of_the_Admiralty) 1919 to 1921

events.text: As China's Fengtiang province was on the verge of losing the [Zhili–Fengtian War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Second_Zhili–Fengtian_War) that Fengtian's leader [Zhang Zuolin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zhang_Zuolin) had started on September 15, Governor [Zheng Shiqi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zheng_Shiqi) of the [Anhui](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anhui) province telegraphed China's President [Cao Kun](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cao_Kun) for aid. [Cao Kun](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cao_Kun) sent 250,000 troops to Manchuria to resist the Fengtian troops, although the additional aid failed to prevent the Fengtian takeover.

British Prime Minister [Ramsay MacDonald](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ramsay_MacDonald) told a gathering in [Derby](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Derby) that his government had secured many valuable concessions in its treaties with the Soviet Union and if the [House of Commons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House_of_Commons_of_the_United_Kingdom) failed to ratify them, he would send the country to another general election.

[Essendon FC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Essendon_Football_Club) (2-0-0) played against [Richmond Tigers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richmond_Football_Club) (1-0-1) in the [final championship series of a round robin tournament](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1924_VFL_season) between the four [Victorian Football League](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Victorian_Football_League) finalists (Essendon, Richmond, [Fitzroy Maroons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fitzroy_Football_Club) and [South Melbourne FC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sydney_Swans)). Despite losing to Richmond, 73 to 86, Essendon won the championship of the tournament. While both teams had finished with records of 2 wins and 1 loss (for 8 points in the standings, based on four for a win and one for a tie), and Richmond had beaten Essendon, the winner was declared based on the ratio of points for against points against. In its first two games, Essendon had scored 130 against 57 for the opposition, while Richmond had 141 against 133. To gain the crown, Richmond would have had to score 66 points more than Essendon in their match. While the tournament winner would normally have played the Grand Final against the team that ended the regular season in first place, Essendon had finished first, so no grand final was played.

The [New York Giants](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1924_New_York_Giants_season) clinched the [National League](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_League_(baseball)) pennant with a 5–1 win over the [Philadelphia Phillies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1924_Philadelphia_Phillies_season).

The auto racing team of driver [Kenelm Lee Guinness](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenelm_Lee_Guinness) and [riding mechanic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/riding_mechanic) [Tom Barrett](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom_Barrett_(riding_mechanic)) crashed at the [San Sebastián Grand Prix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Sebastián_Grand_Prix) in Spain. Barrett was killed, and Guinness was seriously injured and would never return to racing.

sources: [From War to Nationalism: China's Turning Point, 1924–1925](https://books.google.com/books?id=MOK2HJ7BHigC&q=matter+of+days+modern&pg=PA230) - p. 162, Publisher: Cambridge University Press, ISBN: 0-521-52332-X

events.text: The four remaining American aviators in the [round-the-world flight expedition](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/First_aerial_circumnavigation) completed their journey by landing at [Sand Point](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sand_Point,_[Seattle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seattle)) in [Seattle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seattle) in the airplanes *Chicago* (with pilot [Lowell H. Smith](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lowell_H._Smith) and co-pilot Leslie P. Arnold) and *New Orleans* (with pilot Erik H. Nelson and co-pilot John Harding Jr), all four of whom were U.S. Army lieutenants. Four planes (with 8 total crew) had departed from [Sand Point](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sand_Point,_[Seattle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seattle)) on April 6. Including stops for rest and maintenance, the trip took 175 days and covered 27,553 mi. Time 363 hours and 7 minutes.
The [Cecil B. DeMille](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cecil_B._DeMille)-directed film *[Feet of Clay](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Feet_of_Clay_(1924_film))* was released.
The [Nestorian rebellion](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nestorian_rebellion) ended.

images.caption: U.S. Army Lieutenants Smith, Arnold, Nelson and Harding return to Seattle, become the first persons to fly around the world

sources: Around the World in 69 Days - 2013, p. 20, Publisher: Advantage Media, ISBN: 978-1-59932-402-9, Author: Wei Chen

events.text: The [Politis–Kalfov Protocol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Politis–Kalfov_Protocol) was signed at the [League of Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/League_of_Nations) in [Geneva](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geneva) following the [Tarlis incident](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tarlis_incident) of July 27, when 17 Bulgarian peasants were killed by a Greek soldier. Greece's ambassador to the League, [Nikolaos Politis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nikolaos_Politis), and Bulgaria's Foreign Minister [Hristo Kalkov](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/:bg:Hristo_Kalkov), signed the protocol, with Greece agreeing to protect its [Bulgarian-Greek minority](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bulgarians_in_Greece) and even to sponsor schools for Bulgarian-Greek students. The Greek Parliament, however, never ratified the treaty..
The [Dominican Republic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dominican_Republic) was admitted to the [League of Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/League_of_Nations).

The [Washington Senators](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_the_Washington_Senators_(1901–60)) clinched their first [American League](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_League) pennant in franchise history with a 4–2 win over the [Boston Red Sox](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boston_Red_Sox).

Italy's Fascist Premier [Benito Mussolini](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benito_Mussolini) announced plans to build the world's highest skyscraper in Rome. Italian architect [Mario Palanti](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mario_Palanti) proposed a 1,500 foot high pyramidal structure with 4,500 rooms, featuring a concert hall and a huge gymnasium for the training of Olympic athletes.

The [League of Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/League_of_Nations) appointed a commission to look into the [Mosul Question](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mosul_Question).
The German romance film *[Comedy of the Heart](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comedy_of_the_Heart)* was released.

events.text: [Domingos Leite Pereira](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Domingos_Leite_Pereira) became [Prime Minister of Portugal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Portugal) for the third time.

DeMille](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cecil_B._DeMille), and *[Pretty Ladies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pretty_Ladies)* starring [ZaSu Pitts](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ZaSu_Pitts) were released.
Dietzen, a new colony on [Scoresby Sund](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scoresby_Sund) in Greenland, was established by Denmark.

[Tipperary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tipperary_GAA) defeated [Galway](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Galway_GAA) on a score line of 5–6 to 1–5 in the [All-Ireland Senior Hurling Championship Final](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1925_All-Ireland_Senior_Hurling_Championship_Final).

events.text: An attempt by Spanish troops to make an [amphibious landing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/amphibious_warfare) at [Alhucemas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al_Hoceima) Bay ended in disaster. The Spanish withdrew after losing 500 men.
The [Treze Futebol Clube](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Treze_Futebol_Clube) was founded in Brazil.

Amidst unrest in [Shanghai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shanghai), rioting occurred; several were wounded as British police fired on a crowd of over 2,000 demonstrators protesting [unequal treaties](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/unequal_treaty).

It was announced that explorer [Roald Amundsen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roald_Amundsen) had signed a deal with the Italian government to use the dirigible *[N-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norge_(airship))* in another attempt to fly to the [North Pole](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Pole), to be undertaken in 1926.

events.text: [Rif](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riffian_people) rebels surrounded [Tétouan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tétouan).

Russian composer [Igor Stravinsky](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Igor_Stravinsky) completed *[Serenade for piano in A major](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serenade_(Stravinsky))* in [Vienna](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vienna).

In [Detroit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Detroit), a white mob attempted to drive a black family out of the home they had purchased in a white neighborhood. A white man was shot dead in the struggle. Homeowner Dr. [Ossian Sweet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ossian_Sweet) was among those arrested and charged with murder and a famous criminal case dealing with race relations in America would result.

events.text: [John Rodgers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Rodgers_(naval_officer,_World_War_I)) and his crew were spotted by a U.S. submarine as they sailed their disabled [PN-9](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naval_Aircraft_Factory_PN) seaplane toward Nawiliwili Harbor at [Kauai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kauai), nine days after they had gone missing when it went down in the Pacific Ocean. The minesweeper USS *[Tanager](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Tanager_(AM-5))* was dispatched and towed them to shore.

French troops led by Marshal [Philippe Pétain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippe_Pétain) launched a new offensive against the [Rif](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riffian_people) rebels north of the [Ouergha River](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ouergha_River).

events.text: [Western Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Western_Union) Telegraph announced it had established direct unbroken contact between San Francisco and London through a new invention enabling the automatic repetition of signals. Prior to this development, operators at interim points had to copy the message and send it on to the next relay point.
[Xavier University of Louisiana](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xavier_University_of_Louisiana), the first Catholic university for African-Americans in the world, opened.

events.text: The stage production of *The Jazz Singer* opened on Broadway. [George Jessel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Jessel_(actor)) played the starring role which [Al Jolson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al_Jolson) later made famous in the 1927 [film version of the same name](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Jazz_Singer).
[Rif](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riffian_people) pressure on [Tétouan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tétouan) was relieved as Spanish reinforcements broke the siege.

The Byzantine cross appeared in the sky over the city of Athens during an old calendar service, which at the time was being persecuted by the Greek authorities. The Police sent to end the service found themselves weeping alongside the thousands of others who witnessed the miracle. This event attracted many to the cause of preserving the old Greek Orthodox calendar and reinvigorated the faith of many embracing the secularity of the times.

sources: Moors' Attacks Halt Spaniards' March on Adjir - September 16, 1925, p. 12

events.text: Crown Prince [Umberto of Italy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Umberto_II_of_Italy) automatically became a member of the Italian senate, as per the country's constitution, upon his twenty-first birthday.

events.text: [U.S. Secretary of State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Secretary_of_State) [Frank B. Kellogg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_B._Kellogg) announced that British Communist politician [Shapurji Saklatvala](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shapurji_Saklatvala) would not be allowed into the United States to attend the congress of the [Inter-Parliamentary Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inter-Parliamentary_Union) as a British delegate. Kellogg explained that this action was taken in response to revolutionary speeches made by Saklatvala, stating, "I do not believe we should admit foreigners to this country to preach anarchy or revolutionary overthrow of government."

births.text: [Charles Haughey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Haughey), [Taoiseach](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taoiseach) of Ireland, in [Castlebar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Castlebar) (d. 2006); [B.B. King](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/B.B._King), blues musician, near [Berclair, Mississippi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Berclair,_Mississippi) (d. 2015)

deaths.text: **Died:** [Alexander Friedmann](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexander_Friedmann), 37, Russian mathematician (typhoid fever)

events.text: The [American Civil Liberties Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Civil_Liberties_Union) sent a telegram to Secretary [Kellogg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_B._Kellogg) protesting his decision to ban [Shapurji Saklatvala](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shapurji_Saklatvala) from entering the country. Idaho Senator [William Borah](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Borah) also criticized the decision, saying, "We have laws in this country to protect ourselves. If Saklatvala violates them he can be arrested. If he incites Americans to commit crimes, put him in jail."

In [Mexico City](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico_City), eighteen-year-old [Frida Kahlo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frida_Kahlo) was almost killed in a serious accident when the bus she was riding in crashed into a streetcar. Kahlo sustained numerous injuries, including a fractured spinal column, which she never fully recovered from. It was during her two-year recovery in bed that she first began to paint.

deaths.text: **Died:** [Carl Eytel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Eytel), 63, German American artist

events.text: The [Sultan of Morocco](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yusef_of_Morocco) put a $25,000 bounty on the head of [Rif](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riffian_people) leader [Abd el-Krim](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abd_el-Krim).

U.S. President [Coolidge](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Calvin_Coolidge) defended the legality of [Secretary of State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Secretary_of_State) [Kellogg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_B._Kellogg)'s decision to ban [Shapurji Saklatvala](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shapurji_Saklatvala) from entering the country, as Saklatvala was not visiting in the capacity of an official government representative.
[H.P. Lovecraft](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/H.P._Lovecraft) wrote the short story *[In the Vault](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/In_the_Vault)*.

An [escadrille](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/escadrille) of American pilots was known to be flying for the French side.
In New Zealand, Wellington YMCA defeated [Seacliff AFC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seacliff_AFC) to win the [1925 Chatham Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1925_Chatham_Cup) of football.

The [Harold Lloyd](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harold_Lloyd) comedy film *[The Freshman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Freshman_(1925_film))* was released.
[Independiente F.B.C.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Independiente_F.B.C.) was founded in [Paraguay](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paraguay).

All [telephone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/telephone) and [telegraph](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/telegraph) workers in Paris staged a surprise two-hour walkout as a protest against low salaries.

The [War Memorial Auditorium](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_Memorial_Auditorium_(Nashville,_Tennessee)) in [Nashville, Tennessee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nashville,_Tennessee) was dedicated.

[Princess Mafalda of Savoy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Princess_Mafalda_of_Savoy) married [Philipp of Hesse](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philipp,_Landgrave_of_Hesse).

The [Pittsburgh Pirates](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pittsburgh_Pirates) clinched the [National League](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_League_(baseball)) pennant with a 2–1 win over the [Philadelphia Phillies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philadelphia_Phillies).

Germany accepted an invitation to attend a European security conference set to open October 5, with the Swiss town of [Locarno](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Locarno) set as the likely location.

Norwegian athlete [Charles Hoff](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Hoff) broke his own [pole vault](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/pole_vault) record again with a height of 4.25 metres at a meet in [Turku](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turku), Finland.

events.text: The American Debt Funding Commission handed France a plan for settlement of French debt from loans during the [war](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_I), which would see France pay $40 million a year on a total obligation of over $3.3 billion plus interest.

events.text: The British Foreign Office said that the [Treaty of Versailles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Treaty_of_Versailles), particularly [Article 231](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Article_231_of_the_Treaty_of_Versailles), would not be up for revision at the upcoming [Locarno](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Locarno) conference. A communique about the conference included the statement, "The question of Germany's responsibility for the war is not raised by the proposed pact. We are at a loss to know why the German government thought it proper to raise it at this moment, and are obliged to observe that the negotiation of a security pact cannot modify the [Treaty of Versailles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Treaty_of_Versailles) nor alter the judgment of the past."

At a [party congress](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/party_conference) in Liverpool, Britain's [Labour Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Labour_Party_(UK)) overwhelmingly voted against a merger with the [Communist Party of Great Britain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Communist_Party_of_Great_Britain) and to exclude communists from their membership ranks.

Pangalos said new elections would be conducted.

A [Vatican](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Holy_See) committee issued a circular to the directors of pilgrimages notifying them that women found in churches not wearing opaque clothing that covered their head, collar, legs and upper arms would be ejected.

Jewelry valued at $750,000 was stolen from the six-room Plaza Hotel suite of [Woolworth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/F._W._Woolworth_Company) heiress Mrs. Jessie [Woolworth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/F._W._Woolworth_Company) Donahue, daughter of F.W. [Woolworth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/F._W._Woolworth_Company). They were stolen in broad daylight from her bedroom while she was in the bathtub a few feet away.
