[Notable athletes who have died in plane crashes](http://articles.latimes.com/2011/sep/07/sports/la-spw-0908-plane-crash-chart-20110908) - _Los Angeles Times_, September 7, 2011, Author: Houston Mitchell

events.text: Greek soldiers reportedly occupied the town of [Petrich](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Petrich) with the intention of enforcing the country's demands for satisfaction.

births.text: [Robert Rauschenberg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Rauschenberg), artist, in [Port Arthur, Texas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Port_Arthur,_Texas) (d. 2008)

events.text: French Foreign Minister [Aristide Briand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aristide_Briand) called for an extraordinary session of the [League of Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/League_of_Nations) to resolve the conflict between Greece and Bulgaria.

births.text: [Johnny Carson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Johnny_Carson), television host, in [Corning, Iowa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corning,_Iowa) (d. 2005)

sources: Stop War! League to Greece - October 24, 1925, p. 1, Author: Don Skene

events.text: Greece and Bulgaria agreed to allow the [League of Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/League_of_Nations) to mediate in their dispute.

births.text: [Bob Azzam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_Azzam), singer, in [Alexandria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexandria), Egypt (d. 2004); [Luciano Berio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luciano_Berio), composer, in [Oneglia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oneglia), Italy (d. 2003); [Al Feldstein](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al_Feldstein), writer, editor and artist, in [Brooklyn](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brooklyn), New York (d. 2014)

events.text: Former Nicaraguan President [Emiliano Chamorro Vargas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emiliano_Chamorro_Vargas) took over the mountain-top fortress of La Loma overlooking [Managua](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Managua) and demanded that President [Carlos José Solórzano](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carlos_José_Solórzano) make him Minister of War.

The romantic comedy film *[The King on Main Street](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_King_on_Main_Street)* starring [Bessie Love](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bessie_Love) and [Adolphe Menjou](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adolphe_Menjou) was released.

Switzerland held a [federal election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1925_Swiss_federal_election) in which the [Free Democratic Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Free_Democratic_Party_of_Switzerland) maintained its plurality.

sources: [Coercion and Diplomacy: Relations Between the United States and Nicaragua, 1920–1927 Part IV: Chaos](http://www.cat-w.com/nic-chaos.htm) - 2001, Author: Cathleen White

events.text: Nicaraguan President [Solórzano](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carlos_José_Solórzano) acquiesced to [Emiliano Chamorro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emiliano_Chamorro_Vargas)'s demand and made him Minister of War, essentially giving him control of the country.

The [League of Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/League_of_Nations) ordered a cessation of hostilities between Greece and Bulgaria and gave them 24 hours to bring their troops back behind their respective borders.
The British-German drama film *[The Blackguard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Blackguard)* was released.

sources: Ultimatum Given Balkans - October 27, 1925, p. 1

births.text: [Warren Christopher](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Warren_Christopher), 63rd [United States Secretary of State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Secretary_of_State), in [Scranton, North Dakota](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scranton,_North_Dakota) (d. 2011)

events.text: The [court-martial](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/court-martial) of Col. [Billy Mitchell](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Mitchell) began in Washington, D.C.
The Polish crime film *[Vampires of Warsaw](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vampires_of_Warsaw)* was released.

sources: Mitchell Ousts 3 Judges - October 29, 1925, p. 1, Author: James O'Donnell Bennett

events.text: The Balkan crisis ended as Greece completed its withdrawal from Bulgaria. The [League of Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/League_of_Nations) said it would appoint a commission to assign responsibilities and assess damages.

In the [Canadian federal election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1925_Canadian_federal_election), the [Conservative Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conservative_Party_of_Canada_(1867–1942)) led by [Arthur Meighen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arthur_Meighen) won a plurality of seats. However, [Liberal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liberal_Party_of_Canada) Prime Minister [William Lyon Mackenzie King](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Lyon_Mackenzie_King) formed a coalition with the [Progressive Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Progressive_Party_of_Canada) to stay in power.

73-year-old Waddy Thompson Ligon was killed when his converted [Model T](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Model_T) slid off a narrow road south of [Lees Ferry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lees_Ferry) and jammed into a crevasse of the [Grand Canyon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grand_Canyon).

births.text: [Dominick Dunne](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dominick_Dunne), writer and journalist, in [Hartford, Connecticut](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hartford,_Connecticut) (d. 2009); [Robert Hardy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Hardy), actor, in [Cheltenham](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cheltenham), England (d. 2017)

sources: Greeks Leave Bulgarian Soil; League Joyous - October 30, 1925, p. 5, Author: John Steele
Over the Edge: Death in Grand Canyon - Publisher: Puma Press, LLC, ISBN: 978-0-9847858-0-3

events.text: The murder trial of [Ossian Sweet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ossian_Sweet) began with an [all-white jury](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/all-white_jury) and [Clarence Darrow](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clarence_Darrow) representing the defense.

sources: Twenty Famous Lawyers - 2013, p. 21, Publisher: Waterside Press, ISBN: 978-1-904380-98-6, Author: John Hostettler

events.text: The [Persia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Persia)n Parliament formally deposed the exiled [Shah](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shah) of [Persia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Persia), Ahmad [Shah](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shah) Qajar, ending the [Qajar dynasty](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qajar_dynasty) and clearing the path for Prime Minister [Reza Khan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reza_Shah) to assume the throne.

births.text: [John Pople](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Pople), chemist and [Nobel Prize](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobel_Prize_in_Chemistry) laureate, in [Burnham-on-Sea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burnham-on-Sea), England (d. 2004)

deaths.text: **Died:** [Mikhail Frunze](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mikhail_Frunze), 40, Soviet Union [Commisar for Military and Naval Affairs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minister_of_Defence_(Soviet_Union)), during a routine operation; [Max Linder](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Max_Linder), 41, French actor and filmmaker (double suicide with wife)

sources: Dictator Dons Persian Crown; Shah Deposed - _Chicago Daily Tribune_, November 1, 1925, p. 1, Author: H. Basil
[John Pople – Facts](https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/chemistry/1998/pople/facts/) - Publisher: Nobel Prize Outreach AB

events.text: The [British Broadcasting Corporation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/British_Broadcasting_Corporation) was created by royal charter as a publicly funded company, with 773 employees. The first BBC news bulletin was delivered at 6:30 am on January 3

The [1927 Rose Bowl](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1927_Rose_Bowl) matched two of the nation's unbeaten and untied [college football](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/college_football) teams, with the [Stanford Indians](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stanford_Cardinal_football) (10–0–0) against the [Alabama Crimson Tide](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alabama_football) (9–0–0). Stanford led, 7–0, until the final minute, when Alabama blocked a punt, recovered the ball on the 14, and nullified the victory with a 7–7 tie.
[Massachusetts](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Massachusetts) became the first state in the U.S. to require car owners to carry liability insurance.
The tomb of [Tutankhamun](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tutankhamun) was opened for public viewing for the first time since the Egyptian pharaoh's death in 1327 BC.
[Imperial Chemical Industries](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Imperial_Chemical_Industries) was created in Great Britain by the merger of four companies.

births.text: [Doak Walker](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doak_Walker), American football player (Detroit Lions 1950–55); in [Dallas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dallas) (d. 1998)
[Vernon L. Smith](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vernon_L._Smith), American economist, and 2002 Nobel Prize laureate; in [Wichita, Kansas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wichita,_Kansas)

images.caption: Tutankhamun's tomb opened for public viewing

events.text: The [Cristero War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cristero_War) began in villages across [Mexico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico) in the Los Altos region of the state of [Jalisco](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jalisco). The uprising began in protest against anti-clerical laws in [Mexico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico) and the rebels called themselves "Cristeros" as fighters for so named because they fought for Christ.

British [concessions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/concession_(territory)) in [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China), located at [Hankou](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hankou) (Hankow) and [Jiujiang](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jiujiang) (Kiukiang) were invaded by crowds of protesters against British imperialism. A British soldier fired into the crowd at [Hankou](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hankou), killing one protester and wounding dozens of others.  Within days, Britain relinquished control of both [concessions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/concession_(territory)) to the Chinese government, but soon sent troops to protect its concession at [Shanghai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shanghai).

A [large annular solar eclipse](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Solar_eclipse_of_January_3,_1927) covered 99.947% of the Sun, creating a dramatic spectacle for observers in only a tiny path, just 2.1 km wide; however, it was fleeting, lasting a very brief 2.62 seconds at the point of maximum eclipse. The path of the eclipse took it over [New Zealand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Zealand) and [Argentina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina).

births.text: [William Boyett](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Boyett), American character actor known for portraying law enforcement officials, primarily as the co-star, with Martin Milner and Kent McCord as LAPD Sergeant "Mac" MacDonald on all episodes of *[Adam-12](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adam-12)*; in [Akron, Ohio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Akron,_Ohio) (d. 2004)

sources: [W. Boyett, 77; Veteran Stage, Television Actor](http://articles.latimes.com/2005/jan/01/local/me-boyett1) - _Los Angeles Times_, January 1, 2005, Author: Dennis McLellan

[Encyclopedia of Early Television Crime Fighters](https://books.google.com/books?id=nqRkAAAAMAAJ&q=william+boyett) - August 30, 2006, p. 63, Publisher: McFarland & Company, ISBN: 978-0-7864-6409-8, Author: Everett Aaker

events.text: [Boris Rtcheouloff](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boris_Rtcheouloff) filed a patent application for "Means of recording and reproducing pictures, images and the like", the first means for magnetic recording of a television signal onto a moving strip. British patent no. 288,680 was granted in 1928, but the forerunner of [videotape](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/videotape) was never manufactured.

births.text: Dr. [Thomas Noguchi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_Noguchi), Japanese-born American pathologist and [Los Angeles County Coroner](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Los_Angeles_County_Department_of_Medical_Examiner-Coroner) and Chief Medical Examiner from 1967 to 1982, known for his autopsies on famous people who died in Los Angeles; as Tsunetomi Noguchi in [Fukuoka Prefecture](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fukuoka_Prefecture)

events.text: A force of 160 United States Marines was dispatched to [Nicaragua](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicaragua) for the purpose of protecting the American embassy in [Managua](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Managua). The Marines arrived the next day at [Corinto](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corinto,_Chinandega) on the USS *Galveston*.

births.text: [Satguru Sivaya Subramuniyaswami](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Satguru_Sivaya_Subramuniyaswami), Hindu guru, author and publisher; as Robert Hansen in [Oakland, California](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oakland,_California) (d. 2001)

events.text: [Robert G. Elliott](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_G._Elliott), the [state electrician](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/state_electrician) for several states, carried out six executions in the electric chair in the same day. In the morning, he put to death Edward Hinlein, John Devereaux and John McGlaughlin in Boston for the 1925 murder of a night watchman.  Elliott then caught a train to New York, had dinner, took his family to the movies, and then went up to [Sing Sing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sing_Sing), where he carried out the capital punishment for Charles Goldson, Edgar Humes and George Williams for the 1926 murder of another watchman.

At 8:44 am in [New York City](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_City) and 1:44 pm in [London](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London), the first transatlantic [telephone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/telephone) call was made between the two cities. [Walter S. Gifford](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_S._Gifford) of [AT&T](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AT&T) was connected with Sir G. Evelyn V. Murray of the [General Post Office](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/General_Post_Office).  A half minute later, the two were talking.

[Philo T. Farnsworth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philo_T._Farnsworth), a 20-year-old American inventor, filed his first of many patent applications, for a method of electronically scanning images and transmitting them as a [television](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/television) signal. U.S. Patent No. 1,773,980 was granted on August 26, 1930.

The [Harlem Globetrotters](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harlem_Globetrotters) played their very first road game, against a local team in [Hinckley, Illinois](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hinckley,_Illinois). Founded by [Abe Saperstein](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abe_Saperstein), the all African-American team was originally called "Saperstein's New York", before assuming its current name in the 1930s.

[Shadow Lawn](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Summer_White_Houses), the [West Long Branch, New Jersey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/West_Long_Branch,_New_Jersey), home that had served as the "Summer White House" for [Woodrow Wilson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Woodrow_Wilson) from 1916 to 1920, was destroyed by a fire.

The *Kate Adams*, last of the ["side-wheeler"](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/paddle_steamer) steamboats in the United States, was destroyed by fire while at its moorings in [Memphis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Memphis,_[Tennessee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tennessee)), [Tennessee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tennessee).

For the first time in the 368-year history of the *[Index Librorum Prohibitorum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Index_Librorum_Prohibitorum)*, the Roman Catholic Church's list of prohibited books, a newspaper was banned by papal decree. [Pope Pius XI](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pope_Pius_XI) banned the French royalist daily *[Action Française](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Action_Française)* for articles "written against the Holy See and the supreme pontiff himself".

[Seventy-eight children were killed in a panic that followed the outbreak of a fire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laurier_Palace_Theatre_fire) at the Laurier Palace cinema in [Montreal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Montreal). Shortly after the 2:00 matinee began, flames were spotted. On three of the theatre's four fire exits, the evacuation was orderly, but on the stairway at the east side of the building, children were trampled five steps away from the door. The dead ranged in age from 4 to 16. Only one of the victims was older than 18.

images.caption: 78 children killed at Montreal cinema fire

sources: Holy See Bans French Paper - _Salt Lake Tribune_, January 10, 1927, p. 1

[Seventy-Six Children Killed in Panic on Stairway at Fire in East St. Catherine Street Movie Theatre Sunday Afternoon](https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=Fr8DH2VBP9sC&dat=19270110&printsec=frontpage) - _Montreal Gazette_, January 10, 1927, p. 1
Montreal Playhouse Scene of Fire Where Seventy-five Perish - _Salt Lake Tribune_, January 10, 1927, p. 1

events.text: [Fritz Lang](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fritz_Lang)'s silent science fiction film *[Metropolis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolis_(1927_film))* had its world premiere at the [Ufa-Palast am Zoo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ufa-Palast_am_Zoo) in [Berlin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Berlin).

In a special message to Congress, President Coolidge said that the 15 American warships and 5,000 members of the Navy and the Marines would be dispatched toward [Nicaragua](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicaragua) and [Mexico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico) to protect American interests. On the same day, the U.S. Department of the Navy announced that 800 U.S. Marines would be sent to [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China) for the same purpose, to be transported from [Guam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guam) by the cruiser USS *Huron*.

births.text: [Gisele MacKenzie](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gisele_MacKenzie), Canadian-born singer; in [Winnipeg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winnipeg) (d. 2003)
[Johnnie Ray](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Johnnie_Ray), American singer; in [Hopewell, Oregon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hopewell,_Oregon) (d. 1990)
[Otto Stich](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Otto_Stich), [Swiss Federal Council](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swiss_Federal_Council) executive 1983–1995; President, 1988 and 1994 (d. 2012)

images.caption: Replica of the Maria robot from Metropolis

sources: The Ufa story: a history of Germany's greatest film company, 1918–1945 - p. 156, Publisher: University of California Press, Author: Klaus Kreimeier
President Tells Congress Marines Stay in Nicaragua - _Salt Lake Tribune_, January 11, 1927, p. 1
U.S. Marines Go to China - _Salt Lake Tribune_, January 11, 1927, p. 1

events.text: The American freighter *John Tracy*, with 27 men on board, foundered and sank off [Cape Cod](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cape_Cod) during a winter storm. Wreckage, including the vessel's nameplate, would be recovered ten days later.

Thirty-six [Hollywood](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hollywood_(film_industry)) celebrities gathered at the [Ambassador Hotel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ambassador_Hotel_(Los_Angeles)) in [Los Angeles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Los_Angeles) and founded the [Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Academy_of_Motion_Picture_Arts_and_Sciences), for the purpose of acknowledging cinematic excellence. The academy's awards for motion picture industry would later be nicknamed "The Oscars".

deaths.text: **Died:** [Houston Chamberlain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Houston_Chamberlain), 71, British anti-Semite turned German Nazi. His book *The Foundations of the Nineteenth Century* was an inspiration for the Nazi ideology.

sources: Wreckage Gives Tragedy Story - _Salt Lake Tribune_, January 22, 1927, p. 1
Entertainment Celebrities - p. 868, Publisher: Trafford Publishing, Author: Norbert B. Laufenberg

events.text: Major League Baseball Commissioner [Kenesaw Mountain Landis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenesaw_Mountain_Landis) exonerated 21 members of the [Detroit Tigers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Detroit_Tigers) and the [Chicago White Sox](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chicago_White_Sox) from accusations of were absolved and conspiring to bring about a Detroit loss in four-game series in 1917.

At [Tampico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tampico), [Mexico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico), the British steamer *Essex Isles* exploded while its cargo of gasoline barrels was being unloaded. Thirty-seven men, mostly Mexican dockworkers, died in the accident.

[Belgium](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belgium) became the first European power to renounce any claims to use of territory in [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China), and ceded back a concession that had been granted to it at [Tianjin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tianjin).

births.text: [Brock Adams](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brock_Adams), U.S. Congressman for Washington 1965–77, and U.S. Senator 1987–93; in [Atlanta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atlanta), [Georgia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Georgia_(U.S._state)) (d. 2004)
[Sydney Brenner](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sydney_Brenner), South African biologist, Nobel Prize winner 2002; in [Germiston, Gauteng](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germiston,_Gauteng) (d. 2019)

events.text: With four days left in her term, [Texas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Texas) Governor [Miriam A. Ferguson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miriam_A._Ferguson) (known popularly as "Ma Ferguson") halted further grants of clemency to [Texas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Texas) convicts. The lame duck governor had pardoned or commuted the sentences of a record 3,595 persons convicted of crimes, including 1,350 full pardons.

The English broadcaster and rugby player [Teddy Wakelam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teddy_Wakelam) gave the first ever running sports commentary on BBC Radio, a Rugby International match between England and Wales from the Twickenham stadium in Middlesex, which England won by 11 points to 9.

In a split decision on the appeal of the verdict in the [Scopes Trial](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scopes_Trial), the [Tennessee Supreme Court](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tennessee_Supreme_Court) upheld the constitutionality of Section 49-1922 of the Tennessee Code, which prohibited the teaching of evolution. The Court set aside the order for the fine levied against teacher [John T. Scopes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_T._Scopes). Chief Justice [Grafton Green](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grafton_Green) said, "All of us agree that nothing is to be gained by prolonging the life of this bizarre case."

The Dumbarton Bridge linking the town of [Newark, California](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Newark,_California) to the city of [Menlo Park](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Menlo_Park,_California) opened to traffic, becoming the first auto bridge over San Francisco Bay.

births.text: [Yaakov Heruti](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yaakov_Heruti), Polish-born Israeli Zionist militant and political activist (d. 2022)

sources: Scopes Loses and Wins in Court Ruling - _Salt Lake Tribune_, January 16, 1927, p. 1
GREAT BRIDGE OVER OUR BAY IS OPENED TODAY - _The Hayward Review_, January 15, 1927, p. 1

[Ya'acov Heruti, member of the Stern Gang who was sent to Britain to assassinate Ernest Bevin – obituary](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/obituaries/2022/09/20/yaacov-heruti-member-stern-gang-who-sent-britain-assassinate/) - 20 September 2022, Author: Telegraph Obituaries

events.text: [George Young](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Young_(swimmer)), a 17-year-old from Toronto, became the first person to swim the 22 mi between [Catalina Island, California](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catalina_Island,_California), and the mainland. At noon the previous day, 102 competitors dove into the waters for the prize offered by William Wrigley, Jr. Young was the only person to finish the task, arriving at the [Point Vincente Lighthouse](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Point_Vincente_Lighthouse) at 3:47 a.m.

sources: Lad, Flatbroke, Beats Channel to Win $25,000 - _Salt Lake Tribune_, January 17, 1927, p. 1

events.text: Movie comedian [Charlie Chaplin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlie_Chaplin) was ordered to pay $4,000 a month alimony to his wife, [Lita Grey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lita_Grey) Chaplin, by a Los Angeles court. The same day, the Internal Revenue Service filed a lien against Chaplin for seven years of back taxes and penalties, totalling $1,073,721.47 between 1918 and 1924.

births.text: [Eartha Kitt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eartha_Kitt), American actress and singer; in [North, South Carolina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North,_South_Carolina) (d. 2008)

deaths.text: **Died:** [Juliette Gordon Low](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juliette_Gordon_Low), founder of the [Girl Scouts of the USA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Girl_Scouts_of_the_USA) (b. 1860)

events.text: American ratification of the 1923 [Treaty of Lausanne](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Treaty_of_Lausanne), and the establishment of diplomatic relations with [Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey), failed to get approval in the U.S. Senate. Though favored by a 50–34 margin, a two-thirds majority was needed.
The [Food, Drug, and Insecticide Administration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Food_and_Drug_Administration) was established as part of the U.S. Department of Agriculture.

images.caption: U.S. Food and Drug Administration established

events.text: The first legislative session held in [The Council House](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parliament_of_India) of India (now the Parliament House) was opened with a meeting of the Central Legislative Assembly. The House, a circular building covering nearly six acres, is now part of the Parliament Assembly where the [Lok Sabha](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lok_Sabha) and the [Rajya Sabha](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rajya_Sabha) convene.

deaths.text: **Died:** Empress [Carlota of Mexico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carlota_of_Mexico), 86, Belgian princess whose husband reigned as Emperor [Maximilian I of Mexico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maximilian_I_of_Mexico) from 1864 to 1867.

events.text: [Frank L. Smith](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_L._Smith), recently selected to serve as a United States Senator from [Illinois](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Illinois), was not allowed to take the oath of office. The U.S. Senate voted 48–33 against seating him pending further investigation of the financing of his 1926 primary election campaign.

The [Movietone sound system](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Movietone_sound_system), developed by [Fox Film Corporation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fox_Film_Corporation) (later [20th Century Fox](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/20th_Century_Fox)) was first demonstrated to the public, at the [Sam H. Harris Theatre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sam_H._Harris_Theatre) in New York City. Shown by a movie projector equipped to play [sound-on-film](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/sound-on-film), the one-reel film preceded the feature presentation, *What Price Glory?*.  Though not quite synchronized, the film included the sight and sound of popular singer Raquel Meller.

The [Sherlock Holmes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sherlock_Holmes) [short story](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/short_story) "[The Adventure of the Veiled Lodger](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Adventure_of_the_Veiled_Lodger)" by Sir [Arthur Conan Doyle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arthur_Conan_Doyle) was published for the first time in *[Liberty](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liberty_(general_interest_magazine))* magazine in the United States.

A bus, carrying the [Baylor University](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baylor_Bears_men's_basketball) basketball team to a scheduled game against the [University of Texas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University_of_Texas), was struck at a railroad crossing near [Round Rock, Texas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Round_Rock,_Texas). Ten students (including five members of the team) were killed and seven seriously injured.

The *Tamanweis*, a war ceremonial for the [Swinomish](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swinomish) American Indian tribe, was performed for the first time since it had been outlawed by federal law. The occasion, a celebration at [La Conner, Washington](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/La_Conner,_Washington), of the 1855 Mukiliteo peace treaty, also saw a traditional feast and the playing of the game "Fla-Hal".
The comedy film *[The Kid Brother](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Kid_Brother)* starring [Harold Lloyd](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harold_Lloyd) was released.

images.caption: Holmes and Watson help a woman with a problem in "The Adventure of the Veiled Lodger"

events.text: [Ban Johnson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ban_Johnson), who had been President of baseball's [American League](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_League) since its founding in 1900, was fired by vote of the league's eight teams. Johnson had publicly criticized the ruling, by baseball commissioner Landis, on the [Black Sox Scandal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Sox_Scandal). Eight years remained on his contract, so he retained his title, but his duties were assumed by Frank J. Navin of the [Detroit Tigers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Detroit_Tigers).

[California Attorney General](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/California_Attorney_General) [Ulysses S. Webb](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ulysses_S._Webb) rendered an attorney general opinion that dark-skinned [Mexican-Americans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexican-Americans) could be classified as "American Indians" under the state's school segregation law.

sources: Ban Johnson Removed From League office - _Salt Lake Tribune_, January 24, 1927, p. 1

The Mexican Outsiders: A Community History of Marginalization and Discrimination in California - p. 73, Publisher: University of Texas Press, Author: [Martha Menchaca](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martha Menchaca)

events.text: The United Kingdom dispatched 16,000 servicemen to defend the British concession in [Shanghai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shanghai). Commanded by Major General John Duncan, the  [Shanghai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shanghai) Defense Force consisted of 12,000 men from the 13th and 14th British infantry brigades, and the 20th Indian Infantry, to join 3,000 naval ratings and 1,000 marines.

At [Oslo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oslo), the [Storthing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Storthing) voted 112 to 33 to reject a proposal for the complete disarmament of Norway. A bill to reorganize the army and navy was approved as an alternative.

Amid fears that the Coolidge Administration would lead the United States into war with [Mexico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico), the U.S. Senate voted 79–0 to ask President Coolidge to seek arbitration of disputes over oil rights.

The merger of the Remington Typewriter Company and Rand-Kardex Bureau, Inc. (created from the merger of two business recordkeeping systems) formed [Remington Rand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Remington_Rand), which would make the [UNIVAC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UNIVAC), the world's first business computer. Through further mergers, the company became [Sperry Rand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sperry_Rand) (1955), and [Unisys](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unisys) (1986).

[J. Frank Norris](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Frank_Norris), popular Southern Baptist leader, was acquitted of murder charges arising from the July 17, 1926, death of wholesale lumberman Dexter B. Chipps.

births.text: [Antonio Carlos Jobim](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antonio_Carlos_Jobim), Brazilian composer credited with popularizing the [bossa nova](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/bossa_nova) style; in [Rio de Janeiro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rio_de_Janeiro) (d. 1994)

events.text: The American College of Osteopathic Surgeons (ACOS), a non-profit organization to promote [osteopathic medicine in the United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/osteopathic_medicine_in_the_United_States), was incorporated in [Chicago](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chicago).

In [Bannock County, Idaho](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bannock_County,_Idaho), a basketball game in the town of Turner ended in tragedy when an explosion toppled the walls at the recreation hall of the Mormon chapel. Seven people were killed and 20 others seriously injured. The lights had failed and a person lit a match, triggering a gas explosion.

births.text: [José Azcona del Hoyo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/José_Azcona_del_Hoyo), [President of Honduras](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Honduras) 1986–1990; in [La Ceiba](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/La_Ceiba) (d. 2005)

7 Die in Blast Which Topples Walls at Game - _Miami Daily News_, January 27, 1927, p. 1

events.text: United Independent Broadcasters, Inc., was incorporated as a network of 16 radio stations. On September 18, 1927, United would be acquired by [William S. Paley](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_S._Paley) and renamed the [Columbia Broadcasting System](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Columbia_Broadcasting_System), providing CBS Radio, and later the CBS Television Network.

A year after proclaiming himself King of the [Hejaz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hejaz), Arabian sultan [Ibn Saud](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ibn_Saud_of_Saudi_Arabia) proclaimed himself as King of [Najd](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Najd) as well. The independence of the Kingdom of [Hejaz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hejaz) and Nejd was recognized on May 20, 1927, and renamed as the [Kingdom of Saudi Arabia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kingdom_of_Saudi_Arabia) in 1932.

[Ty Cobb](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ty_Cobb) and [Tris Speaker](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tris_Speaker), two of the greatest outfielders in American baseball history, were both exonerated of charges of wrongdoing by Commissioner Landis. Both had been accused, by [Dutch Leonard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dutch_Leonard_(left-handed_pitcher)), of conspiracy to throw a game in 1919.  Cobb was elected to baseball's Hall of Fame in its first year (1936), and Speaker in its second.

A hurricane swept across the [British Isles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/British_Isles), killing twenty people and injuring hundreds. Nineteen of the dead were in Scotland, including eight in [Glasgow](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glasgow), and another person was killed in Ireland.  The storm moved on a line from Land's End in England, to John O'Groats in Scotland.

births.text: [Hiroshi Teshigahara](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hiroshi_Teshigahara), Japanese director; in [Chiyoda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chiyoda,_Tokyo) (d. 2001)

events.text: In [Schenectady, New York](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Schenectady,_New_York), the [General Electric](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/General_Electric) Company demonstrated its [own sound-on-film process](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RCA_Photophone), the first to synchronize recorded sights and sounds on a single strip of film. The product of six years research opened a new era in movies, taking the world from silent films to the "talkies".

births.text: [Lewis Urry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lewis_Urry), Canadian engineer who invented the [alkaline battery](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/alkaline_battery) and the [lithium battery](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/lithium_battery); in [Pontypool, Ontario](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pontypool,_Ontario) (d. 2004)
[Edward Abbey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Abbey), American environmentalist; in [Indiana, Pennsylvania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indiana,_Pennsylvania) (d. 1989)

events.text: At the [Austrian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Austria) village of [Schattendorf](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Schattendorf), members of the [right-wing veterans' organization "Frontkampfer Vereinigung" fired on](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/July_Revolt_of_1927) members of the leftist organization [Schutzbund](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Schutzbund), killing one of them and seriously wounding five others. An 8-year old bystander was killed by the gunfire.  When a jury acquitted the three Frontkampfer three months later, 84 protesters were killed by the [Austrian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Austria) police.

births.text: [Olof Palme](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olof_Palme), [Prime Minister of Sweden](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Sweden) 1969–76 and 1982–86; in [Östermalm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Östermalm) (assassinated 1986)

events.text: After seven years, the Inter-Allied Military Commission, which had overseen the occupation of Germany since the end of [World War I](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_I), closed its headquarters in [Berlin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Berlin) after France's Marshal [Ferdinand Foch](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ferdinand_Foch) declared that Germany's obligations under the [Treaty of Versailles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Treaty_of_Versailles) had been completed.

[Mae West](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mae_West)'s play *The Drag*, the first theatrical production to address homosexuality, had its world premiere in [Bridgeport, Connecticut](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bridgeport,_Connecticut). West hired 40 gay men for the cast. Although profitable, the play was banned by police in [Bayonne, New Jersey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bayonne,_New_Jersey), and was unable to find a theatre in New York City.

deaths.text: **Died:** [Sybil Bauer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sybil_Bauer), 23, American swimmer who broke 23 women's world records and (in 1922) the men's world record for the 440 backstroke, died of cancer. Bauer, who did not learn to swim until she was 15, had been engaged to marry [Ed Sullivan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ed_Sullivan).

sources: Commission of Allies Leaves German Soil - _Berkeley Daily Gazette_, January 31, 1927, p. 1
[Momentous Transition](http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,729993,00.html) - February 14, 1927

events.text: [Gerardo Machado](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gerardo_Machado) was [elected](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cuban_general_election,_1924) [president of Cuba](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/president_of_Cuba) under the [Liberal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liberal_Party_of_Cuba)-Popular Coalition banner.
[Éamon de Valera](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Éamon_de_Valera) was sentenced to a month in prison for entering [Ulster](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ulster) illegally.
[Club Sport Colombia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Club_Sport_Colombia) was founded in [Paraguay](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paraguay).

births.text: [Süleyman Demirel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Süleyman_Demirel), [President of Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Turkey) 1993 to 2000; Prime Minister of Turkey five times between 1965 and 1993; in [İslamköy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/İslamköy) (d. 2015)

sources: Chronicle of the 20th Century - 1989, p. 324, Publisher: Chronicle Communications Ltd., ISBN: 978-0-582-03919-3, Author: Derrik Mercer

events.text: [Uruguay](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uruguay_national_football_team) and [Argentina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team) played to a scoreless draw in the [South American Championship](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1924_South_American_Championship) of soccer football. [Uruguay](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uruguay_national_football_team) finished in first place with a record of 2-1-0 (for 5 points) compared to [Argentina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team)'s 1-2-0 (for 4 points), to win [Uruguay](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uruguay_national_football_team)'s fifth [Copa América](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Copa_América).
[Feng Yuxiang](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Feng_Yuxiang)'s troops entered [Tianjin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tianjin).

[Calvin Coolidge](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Calvin_Coolidge) and [John W. Davis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_W._Davis) made their final appeals to voters with radio addresses on the eve of the presidential election.

The [League of Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/League_of_Nations) opened its first session of the International Opium Conference, addressing the issue of [opium](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/opium) smoking and addiction.

sources: Feng's Troops in Tientsin as Ex-Chief Flees - November 4, 1924, p. 12, Author: Charles Fox

events.text: [Calvin Coolidge](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Calvin_Coolidge) of the [Republican Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_Party_(United_States)) was elected to a second term in the [U.S. presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1924_United_States_presidential_election), as [Democratic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Democratic_Party_(United_States)) opponent [John W. Davis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_W._Davis) nearly swept the [South](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Southern_United_States) but was unable to carry any other states. Third-party candidate [Robert M. La Follette](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_M._La_Follette,_Sr.) won his home state of [Wisconsin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wisconsin) and its 13 electoral votes, while Coolidge had 382 electoral votes and Davis had 136.

A violent encounter took place in Rome during parades commemorating the sixth anniversary of the Italian Armistice. Accounts vary as to what happened, but it appears that anti-Fascist war veterans objected to attempts by [Blackshirts](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Milizia_Volontaria_per_la_Sicurezza_Nazionale) to join their march. Angry words were exchanged, fights broke out and a ceremony in the [Piazza Venezia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Piazza_Venezia) was called off. The incident became another scandal for [Benito Mussolini](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benito_Mussolini)'s government as even members of his inner circle were appalled at what was seen as an attack on Italy's war veterans.
[Stanley Baldwin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stanley_Baldwin) became [Prime Minister of the United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_the_United_Kingdom) again.

deaths.text: **Died:** [Gabriel Fauré](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gabriel_Fauré), 79, French composer

events.text: Former Chinese emperor [Puyi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Puyi) was expelled from the [Forbidden City](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forbidden_City) and all Manchu titles were abolished.
[Nikola Pašić](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nikola_Pašić) became [Prime Minister of Yugoslavia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Yugoslavia) for the second time.
The [A. A. Milne](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A._A._Milne) poetry collection *[When We Were Very Young](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/When_We_Were_Very_Young)* was published.

[Winston Churchill](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winston_Churchill) was named [Chancellor of the Exchequer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chancellor_of_the_Exchequer), a surprising move on the part of [Stanley Baldwin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stanley_Baldwin) as Churchill had no experience in finance.

births.text: [Harlon Block](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harlon_Block), U.S. marine and [flag raiser on Iwo Jima](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raising_the_Flag_on_Iwo_Jima), in [Yorktown, Texas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yorktown,_Texas) (d. 1945)

[Jeanette Schmid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jeanette_Schmid), notable whistler, in [Volary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volary), [Sudetenland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sudetenland), [Czechoslovakia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Czechoslovakia) (d. 2005)

The [Ignaz Seipel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ignaz_Seipel) government resigned in Austria.

In [Honolulu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Honolulu), [Hawaii](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hawaii), Korean nationalist [Syngman Rhee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syngman_Rhee) announced plans for a new Korean independence movement.

births.text: [Evelyn Wawryshyn](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evelyn_Wawryshyn), Canadian born baseball player in the [AAGPBL](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AAGPBL), inductee to the [Canadian Baseball Hall of Fame](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canadian_Baseball_Hall_of_Fame); in [Tyndall, Manitoba](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rural_Municipality_of_Brokenhead) (d. 2022)

events.text: A new session of Italian parliament opened with 185 opposition members absent in protest. This boycott became known as the [Aventine Secession](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aventine_Secession_(20th_century)).

The [Tientsin Conference](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tientsin_Conference) began with powerful [warlords](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_warlords_and_military_cliques_in_the_Warlord_Era) meeting to discuss the future government of [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beiyang_government) and hopefully reconcile with [Sun Yat-sen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sun_Yat-sen)'s[ rival government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Army_and_Navy_Marshal_stronghold_of_the_Republic_of_China) in [Canton](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guangzhou).

events.text: France clashed with the United States over a letter from [reparations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_I_reparations) agent [Seymour Parker Gilbert](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seymour_Parker_Gilbert) stating that Britain and France were not entitled to collect a tax of 26 percent on German imports as part of [reparations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_I_reparations) payments under the [Dawes Plan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dawes_Plan). France contended that the import tax had nothing to do with the Plan.

The United Kingdom angered Japan at the International Opium Conference in [Geneva](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geneva) when British delegate [Malcolm Delevingne](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malcolm_Delevingne) said that Great Britain could not habitually recognize import certificates, because they were often diverted on the way to the country of purchase for illicit purposes by high officials in one far eastern country that he "preferred not to name."

sources: Allies Clash with U.S. Head of Dawes Plan - November 16, 1924, p. 5, Author: [George Seldes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George Seldes)
Japanese Bolt Opium Accord; Blame Britain - November 17, 1924, p. 1

events.text: French troops evacuated the right bank of the [Rhine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rhine) between [Cologne](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cologne) and [Koblenz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Koblenz).
Japan essentially quit the International Opium Conference, claiming the proposed agreement was discriminatory against them and that the British delegation had offended Japan's honour.

births.text: [Mel Patton](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mel_Patton), U.S. track and field sprinter and 1948 Olympic gold medalist, known for settomg the world record of 9.2 seconds in the 100 yard dash in 1948 and breaking the record of [Jesse Owens](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jesse_Owens) in the 220 yard dash in 1949; in Los Angeles (d. 2014)

events.text: The Canadian province of [Ontario](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ontario) said it would build a "dry navy" to co-operate with American Prohibition enforcement agents unless the Canadian federal government did more to stop [rum-running](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/rum-running).
The film *[A Sainted Devil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Sainted_Devil)*, starring [Rudolph Valentino](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rudolph_Valentino), was released.

sources: Ontario Joins U.S. in Fight on Rum Runners - November 18, 1924, p. 16

events.text: Britain asked the [League of Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/League_of_Nations) for an indefinite postponement of any further discussion on the [Geneva Protocol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geneva_Protocol_(1924)).

events.text: Major-General Sir [Lee Stack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lee_Stack), British [Governor-General](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Governor-General) of the [Anglo-Egyptian Sudan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anglo-Egyptian_Sudan) and [Sirdar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sirdar) of the Egyptian Army, was shot in [Cairo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cairo) by a gang of Egyptian nationalist students, dying the following day.

Hollywood producer [Thomas H. Ince](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_H._Ince) died at his estate in California, two days after leaving a gathering attended by many celebrities aboard [William Randolph Hearst](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Randolph_Hearst)'s private yacht, the *[Oneida](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_''Oneida''_(SP-432))*. The cause of death was officially given as a [heart attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/heart_attack), but wild rumors circulated that he had been shot or somehow otherwise fatally afflicted under circumstances that were covered up. A 2001 film, *[The Cat's Meow](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Cat's_Meow)*, is based on the rumors.
The legislature of the [Philippines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippines) passed a resolution calling for complete independence from the United States.

events.text: [Fethi Okyar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fethi_Okyar) became the new [Prime Minister of Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Turkey).

The British government sent a message to Egyptian Prime Minister [Saad Zaghloul](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saad_Zaghloul) demanding complete satisfaction in the matter of the assassination of [Governor-General](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Governor-General) [Sir Lee Stack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lee_Stack), including punishment of those responsible and a payment of £500,000 in compensation. Britain blamed the assassination on the Egyptian government's failure to take steps to suppress anti-British agitation.

events.text: [Edwin Hubble](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edwin_Hubble) announced his discovery that [Andromeda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andromeda_Galaxy), previously believed to be a [nebula](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/nebula), is actually another [galaxy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/galaxy), and that the [Milky Way](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Milky_Way) is only one of many such galaxies in the universe.

Embattled Italian leader [Benito Mussolini](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benito_Mussolini) apologized for the events in Rome on November 4 and promised to take steps to keep his [Blackshirts](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Milizia_Volontaria_per_la_Sicurezza_Nazionale) under control.

Zaghloul was succeeded by [Ahmad Ziwar Pasha](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ahmad_Ziwar_Pasha).

Radio stations in the United States broadcast an "hour of silence" between 10 and 11 p.m., setting it aside for international broadcasting tests. Listeners as far west as [Duluth, Minnesota](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Duluth,_Minnesota) reported being able to hear broadcasting from England, France and Spain.

events.text: The [Mongolian People's Republic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mongolian_People's_Republic) was proclaimed.

The verdicts in the [trial of the 149](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/trial_of_the_149) were read in [Estonia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Estonia). Seven people were acquitted and all the others were sentenced to varying terms of either prison or forced labour.
The first [Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Macy's_Thanksgiving_Day_Parade) was held in New York City.

[Mussolini](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benito_Mussolini)'s newspaper *[Il Popolo d'Italia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Il_Popolo_d'Italia)* warned that [civil war](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/civil_war) would break out unless the opposition ceased its "campaign of defamation."

events.text: A public broadcasting station, [NHK (Japan Broadcasting Corporation)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NHK) was founded in Japan, as predecessor name was Tokyo Broadcasting Station.

The [Army–Navy Game](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Army–Navy_Game) was won by Army 12-0 in [Baltimore](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baltimore). U.S. president [Calvin Coolidge](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Calvin_Coolidge) was among the 80,000 in attendance.

In the [12th Grey Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/12th_Grey_Cup) of Canadian football, [Queen's University](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Queen's_University_at_Kingston) beat the [Toronto Balmy Beach Beachers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toronto_Balmy_Beach_Beachers) 11-3 at [Varsity Stadium](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Varsity_Stadium).
The [Montreal Forum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Montreal_Forum) opened in Canada.

events.text: The [1924 NFL season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1924_NFL_season) officially ended with the [Cleveland Bulldogs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cleveland_Bulldogs) atop the standings.

[Plutarco Elías Calles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plutarco_Elías_Calles) was inaugurated as the 40th [president of Mexico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/president_of_Mexico). The National Stadium in [Mexico City](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico_City) was packed for the event that only lasted fifteen minutes.

Editor of British newspaper *[The People](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Sunday_People)* [Hannen Swaffer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hannen_Swaffer) recounted a [séance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/séance) he attended along with [Arthur Conan Doyle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arthur_Conan_Doyle), [Sir Robert McAlpine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sir_Robert_McAlpine,_1st_Baronet) and others. Swaffer said that the medium contacted [Lord Northcliffe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alfred_Harmsworth,_1st_Viscount_Northcliffe), who admitted that Doyle was right about life beyond the grave. "I distrusted your judgement, but I see now how wrong I was", the spirit voice of Northcliffe was quoted as saying.

events.text: [Full time airmail service began in the U.S.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_airmail_service) with a fleet of airplanes transporting the mail day and night. The time for sending mail between New York and [San Francisco](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Francisco) was decreased from 70 hours to a little less than 35 hours westward and around 32 hours eastward. Stops by the airplanes for mail transfer and relief of crew were made at established air stations along the fully-equipped [Transcontinental Airway System](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcontinental_Airway_System) at [New York City](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_City); [Bellefonte, Pennsylvania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bellefonte,_Pennsylvania); [Cleveland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cleveland) and [Bryan, Ohio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bryan,_Ohio); [Chicago](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chicago); [Iowa City](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iowa_City); [Omaha](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Omaha) and [North Platte, Nebraska](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Platte,_Nebraska); [Cheyenne](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cheyenne,_Wyoming), [Rawlins](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rawlins,_Wyoming) and [Rock Springs, Wyoming](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rock_Springs,_Wyoming); [Salt Lake City](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salt_Lake_City); [Elko](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elko,_Nevada) and [Reno](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reno,_Nevada); and [San Francisco](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Francisco).

Japan held a national day of protest of the United States' [Immigration Act](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1924_Immigration_Act) the day it went into effect. Mass prayer meetings were conducted at [Shinto shrines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shinto_shrine) all over the country and an unknown Japanese man cut down the American flag at the U.S. embassy in Tokyo. The Japanese government gave the United States a formal note of regret over the flag theft. The flag was recovered the next day The perpetrator was arrested on July 3 in [Osaka](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Osaka) and explained that he wanted to do something "heroic" before he died for his country.

At the [Democratic National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1924_Democratic_National_Convention), [William Gibbs McAdoo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Gibbs_McAdoo) lost ground in balloting as [Al Smith](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al_Smith) and [John W. Davis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_W._Davis) steadily gained.

events.text: [Portugal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portugal)'s Prime Minister [Álvaro de Castro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Álvaro_de_Castro) fought a sword [duel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/duel) with Flight Captain [Teófilo José Ribeiro da Fonseca](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/:pt:Teófilo_José_Ribeiro_da_Fonseca) over a political dispute. Captain Ribiero was wounded in the arm.

Inventor [Guglielmo Marconi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guglielmo_Marconi) addressed the [Royal Society of Arts](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Royal_Society_of_Arts) in London describing his new beam system of short-wave wireless transmission. Marconi said this system could transmit more words per day between distant countries than was possible before, and more economically as well, resulting in a general reduction in telegraphic rates.

Italian border patrollers shot and killed two [Serbian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serbia) soldiers and wounded a civilian bystander at the [Serbian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serbia) boundary line.

events.text: The [Caesar salad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caesar_salad) was created in [Mexico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico) by Italian-born restaurateur [Caesar Cardini](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caesar_Cardini) at his restaurant in [Tijuana](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tijuana), [Caesar's](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caesar's). According to the Cardini family, Caesar had been unprepared for the large number of Americans crossing the border to legally purchase liquor at his eatery during the long Fourth of July weekend, and conserved his available supply of food by putting together the large salad in the middle of the dining room.

A new version of the [Progressive Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Progressive_Party_(United_States,_1924)), unrelated to the previous [organization nicknamed the "Bull Moose" Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Progressive_Party_(United_States,_1912–1920)), opened a convention in [Cleveland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cleveland) and nominated U.S. Senator [Robert M. La Follette](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_M._La_Follette,_Sr.) of [Wisconsin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wisconsin) as a third-party candidate for U.S. president.

British tennis player [Kitty McKane Godfree](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kitty_McKane_Godfree) defeated [Helen Wills](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Helen_Wills) of the U.S. to win the [women's singles championship](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1924_[Wimbledon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1924_Wimbledon_Championships)_Championships_–_Women's_Singles) at the [Wimbledon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1924_Wimbledon_Championships).
[Glacier National Park](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glacier_National_Park_(U.S.)) concessions worker Donald T. Fly drowned in [Saint Mary Lake](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saint_Mary_Lake).
Calvin Coolidge, Jr. was reported to be seriously ill.

events.text: The official opening ceremonies for the [Summer Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1924_Summer_Olympics) were conducted at [Colombes Stadium](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stade_Olympique_Yves-du-Manoir) in Paris, France. Germany was absent for the second consecutive Olympics, having not been invited by the Organizing Committee.

[Jean Borotra](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jean_Borotra) defeated fellow Frenchman [René Lacoste](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/René_Lacoste) in the [Men's Singles Final](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1924_[Wimbledon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1924_Wimbledon_Championships)_Championships_–_Men's_Singles) at [Wimbledon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1924_Wimbledon_Championships).

[Rebellion broke out](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/São_Paulo_Revolt_of_1924) in the Brazilian city of [São Paulo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/São_Paulo) as a group of lieutenants and other junior Brazilian Army officers— the "tenentes"— sought to overthrow [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_presidents_of_Brazil) [Arthur Bernardes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arthur_Bernardes). The revolt would last for 23 days, during which 1,000 people were killed and another 4,000 injured during the [bombardment of the city](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bombing_of_São_Paulo) by troops loyal to the government.

events.text: A [presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1924_Mexican_general_election) was held in [Mexico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico). [Plutarco Elías Calles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plutarco_Elías_Calles) of the [Partido Laborista Mexicano](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laborist_Party_(Mexico)) won the [presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1924_Mexican_general_election) with 84.1% of the vote, with 1,340,634 in his favor. Runner-up Angel Flores had 252,599 votes or 15.9%.

[Ville Ritola](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ville_Ritola) of Finland won gold in the [10,000m race](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Athletics_at_the_1924_Summer_Olympics_–_Men's_10,000_metres) at the [Paris Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1924_Summer_Olympics). [Paavo Nurmi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paavo_Nurmi), the greatest long-distance runner at the time, had hoped to break a record in the event but Finnish officials refused to enter him in it because they feared for his health if he competed in too many events, a decision that angered Nurmi.

births.text: [Robert M. White](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Michael_White), U.S. Air Force test pilot who was one of 12 Americans to pilot the [North American X-15](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_American_X-15), and the first person to fly an aircraft at [Mach](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mach_(speed)) 4, [Mach](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mach_(speed)) 5 and [Mach](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mach_(speed)) 6; in New York City (d.2010)

[Wesley L. McDonald](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wesley_L._McDonald), U.S. Navy aviator who, in 1965, led the first U.S. air strike against North Vietnam, and in 1983, as an Admiral, was the commander the U.S. invasion of Grenada; in [Washington D.C.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Washington_D.C.) (d.2009)

[Ernest Graves Jr.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ernest_Graves_Jr.), U.S. Army officer and former Director of the [Defense Security Assistance Agency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Defense_Security_Assistance_Agency); in [New York City](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_City) (d. 2019)

sources: [Now You Know: Big Book of Sports](https://archive.org/details/nowyouknowbigboo0000lenn_j6r9/page/232) - 2009, Publisher: Magnetawan Communications, Inc. and Dundurn Press Ltd., ISBN: 978-1-55488-454-4, Author: Doug Lennox

events.text: [Calvin Coolidge Jr.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Calvin_Coolidge), the 16-year-old son of the President of the United States, died at 10:30 in the morning from sepsis caused by an infection on his foot, developed from blisters after having played a game of tennis on the White House grounds a week earlier. The president and Mrs. Coolidge were at their son's bedside.

The [Philippine Scout Mutiny](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippine_Scout_Mutiny) broke out at [Fort William McKinley](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fort_Bonifacio) near [Manila](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manila), as Filipino members of the U.S. Army, who received lesser pay than the American troops. The rebellion was quickly suppressed by the 23rd Infantry Brigade of the U.S. Army's Philippine Division, commanded by Brigadier General [Douglas MacArthur](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Douglas_MacArthur), and 200 of the mutineers were arrested. MacArthur's subsequent attempts to improve the pay and working conditions of Filipino soldiers and officers were unsuccessful.

British track athlete [Harold Abrahams](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harold_Abrahams), an English Jew who faced anti-Semitic prejudice, won the [100 meter sprint at the Summer Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Athletics_at_the_1924_Summer_Olympics_–_Men's_100_metres) in [Paris](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paris). His friend [Eric Liddell](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eric_Liddell), a Scottish Christian missionary, had not entered the 100m dash because he had refused to run on a Sunday, the day of the qualifying heats. Abrahams, whose story was profiled in the Academy Award winning 1981 film *[Chariots of Fire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chariots_of_Fire)*, finished in 10.6 seconds, one-tenth of a second a head of the heavily-favored entrant from the U.S., [Jackson Scholz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jackson_Scholz).

New York Governor [Alfred E. Smith](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alfred_E._Smith) passed former Secretary of the Treasury [William Gibbs McAdoo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Gibbs_McAdoo) on the 87th ballot at the [Democratic National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1924_Democratic_National_Convention), with 361½ to McAdoo's 333½ before the convention adjourned early out of respect for the President. Neither candidate had 729 votes, the two-thirds majority necessary to be nominated.

births.text: [Benedikt Gröndal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benedikt_Sigurðsson_Gröndal), Prime Minister of Iceland, 1979 to 1980; in Önundarfjörður (d. 2010)
[Eddie Romero](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eddie_Romero), Philippine film director; in [Dumaguete](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dumaguete) (d.2013)

[Rudolf Pleil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rudolf_Pleil), West German serial killer convicted of murdering at least 10 people; in [Bärenstein](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bärenstein) (committed suicide, 1958)

[National Artist Eddie Romero dies](http://www.rappler.com/entertainment/30143-national-artist-eddie-romero-dies) - May 28, 2013

events.text: At the Democratic National Convention, delegates divided between [Alfred E. Smith](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alfred_E._Smith) (who had moved into the front after the 86th ballot) and former frontrunner [William G. McAdoo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_G._McAdoo). After a recess following the 93rd ballot, offered to take his name out of contention if McAdoo would do the same. Indiana U.S. Senator [Samuel M. Ralston](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samuel_M._Ralston) in third place, released his delegates, but McAdoo refused the Smith offer before it could be announced on the floor of the convention. On the 94th ballot, took the lead again with 395 over 364.5 for Smith, with John W. Davis moving into third place. Balloting continued past midnight until an adjournment at 4:00 a.m.

The [Communist International](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Communist_International) in Moscow condemned the U.S. [Immigration Act](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Immigration_Act_of_1924) and passed a resolution advocating unrestricted worldwide immigration.

deaths.text: **Died:** [Walter R. Allman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_R._Allman), 40, American comic strip artist who wrote and drew *The Doings of the Duffs* from its launch in 1914 until 1923, when he suffered a nervous breakdown.

sources: Denounce U.S. Immigrant Law at Red Congress - July 9, 1924, p. 7, Author: Donald Day
[Walter Allman, Creator of 'The Duffs,' is Dead](https://www.newspapers.com/clip/46350385/walter-allman-creator-of-the-duffs/) - _Stockton Daily Evening Record_, 1924-07-08, p. 6

events.text: Little-known former congressman [John W. Davis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_W._Davis) of [West Virginia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/West_Virginia) became the surprise winner at the [Democratic National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1924_Democratic_National_Convention), securing the presidential nomination on the 103rd ballot as something of a compromise candidate. [Charles W. Bryan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_W._Bryan) of [Nebraska](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nebraska) earned the nomination for vice president. [William Gibbs McAdoo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Gibbs_McAdoo) withdrew reluctantly and ungraciously, leaving the [Democrats](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Democratic_Party_(United_States)) bitterly divided heading into the general campaign.

[Colombia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colombia) gave diplomatic recognition to the Republic of [Panama](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panama), more than 20 years after [Panama](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panama) had seceded from [Colombia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colombia) on November 3, 1903, at the encouragement of the United States.

In voting of members of the [Grossdeutsche Volksgemeinschaft](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greater_German_People's_Community) (GVD), the right-wing organization formed after the outlawing of the [Nazi Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazi_Party), founder [Alfred Rosenberg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alfred_Rosenberg) was ousted and by the more aggressive [Julius Streicher](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Julius_Streicher) as Chairman of the GVD. [Hermann Esser](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hermann_Esser) was selected as the Deputy Chairman. The GVD, founded on January 1, 1924, would be disbanded by Streicher on March 12, 1925, after the [Nazi Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazi_Party) was re-established by [Adolf Hitler](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adolf_Hitler).
The funeral for Calvin Coolidge, Jr. in Washington, D.C. Flags were lowered to half-mast and all nonessential government offices closed at 3:30 p.m.

The aviators trying to [circumnavigate the globe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/First_aerial_circumnavigation) flew from [Baghdad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baghdad) to [Aleppo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aleppo).

births.text: [Mashiur Rahman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mashiur_Rahman_(prime_minister)), [Prime Minister of Bangladesh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_prime_ministers_of_Bangladesh), 1978 to 1979; in [Rangpur](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rangpur,_Bangladesh), [Bengal Province](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bengal_Presidency), [British India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/British_India) (d. 1979)

[Pierre Cochereau](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pierre_Cochereau), French organist for the [Notre-Dame de Paris](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Notre-Dame_de_Paris), and musical composer; in [Saint-Mandé](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saint-Mandé), [Val-de-Marne](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Val-de-Marne) *département* (d.1984)

Calvin Coolidge, Jr. was buried at the [Plymouth Notch Cemetery](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plymouth_Notch_Cemetery) in [Vermont](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vermont).

events.text: The [World Energy Council](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Energy_Council) was founded as the World Power Conference at a meeting of the same name in [London](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London), where more than 1,700 experts from 40 nations gathered to discuss energy issues. [D. N. Dunlop](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daniel_Nicol_Dunlop) of Scotland, who had organized the conference, was elected as the organization's first secretary-general.

births.text: [Brett Somers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brett_Somers), Canadian-born U.S. actress, singer and comedian; in [Saint John, New Brunswick](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saint_John,_New_Brunswick) (d. 2007)
[Charlie Tully](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlie_Tully), Northern Irish footballer; in [Belfast](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belfast) (d. 1971)

B. van Heutsz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._B._van_Heutsz), Dutch military officer and former [Governor-general of the Dutch East Indies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Governor-general_of_the_Dutch_East_Indies) (now Indonesia), known for bringing an end to the [Aceh War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aceh_War)

events.text: [Harold Osborn](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harold_Osborn) of the U.S. won the [men's decathlon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Athletics_at_the_1924_Summer_Olympics_–_Men's_decathlon) at the Summer Olympics in [Paris](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paris), finishing ahead of 35 other competitors. Osborn finish first in the 100m dash, the high jump, and the 110m hurdles, and in second place in the long jump and the pole vault.

[Paavo Nurmi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paavo_Nurmi) won the 10,000m cross-country race at the Olympics and then helped to win another gold medal for Finland in the team event. The races were held in blistering heat of 45 degrees Celsius; cross-country races were never an event at the Olympics again because of the number of runners collapsing from [heat exhaustion](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heat_illness).

Driving at 146.16 mph in his [Fiat Mephistopheles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiat_Mephistopheles), [Ernest Eldridge](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ernest_Eldridge) of Great Britain broke the land speed record of 145.89 mph set earlier in the week (on Sunday, July 6) by [Rene Thomas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/René_Thomas_(racing_driver)) of France. Both records had been set on a public road at [Arpajon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arpajon), after which the [Fédération Internationale de l'Automobile](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fédération_Internationale_de_l'Automobile) announced that it would only recognize records set on closed racing circuits, bringing an end to attempts to set a land speed record on a roadway used by other motor vehicles.

The airmen attempting to be the first to [fly around the world](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/First_aerial_circumnavigation) landed in [Bucharest](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bucharest) from [Constantinople](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Istanbul).
The original trademark application for [Kleenex](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kleenex) was filed by [Kimberly-Clark](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kimberly-Clark) Corporation.

sources: Yankee Airmen in Bucharest - July 13, 1924, p. 4, Author: John Clayton

events.text: United States administration of the [Dominican Republic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dominican_Republic) ended as [Horacio Vásquez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horacio_Vásquez) was inaugurated as [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_presidents_of_the_Dominican_Republic), succeeding the U.S.-selected provisional president [Juan Bautista Vicini Burgos](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juan_Bautista_Vicini_Burgos) stepped aside.

The [Rex Ingram](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rex_Ingram_(director))-directed film *[The Arab](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Arab_(1924_film))* opened at the [Capitol Theatre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capitol_Theatre_(New_York_City)) in New York City.

events.text: The short-lived [Tungus Republic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tungus_Republic) was proclaimed independent within the [Khabarovsk Krai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khabarovsk_Krai) and part of the [Yakut Autonomous Soviet Socialist Republic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yakut_Autonomous_Soviet_Socialist_Republic) of the Soviet Union in [Siberia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siberia). Rebels under the command of [Mikhail Artemyev](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mikhail_Artemyev) had seized the rural town of [Nelkan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nelkan) on May 10 and the port of [Ayan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ayan,_Russia) on June 6. The Republic would surrender to the Soviet government on May 9, 1925.

A reported 35 people died in [forest fires](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/forest_fire) in the U.S. states of [Washington](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Washington_(state)), [California](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/California) and [Idaho](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Idaho) and  the Canadian province of [British Columbia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/British_Columbia).

The premiere of the Harold Child opera *[Hugh the Drover](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hugh_the_Drover)* took place at [His Majesty's Theatre, London](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/His_Majesty's_Theatre,_London).

The aviators attempting to be the first to [fly around the world](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/First_aerial_circumnavigation) reached Paris, circling over the [Arc de Triomphe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arc_de_Triomphe).

events.text: The first major nationwide news story in the U.S. about a tall, hairy "apeman" that walked upright, in the Pacific Northwest was published in *[The Oregonian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Oregonian)*, the largest circulation newspaper in [Portland, Oregon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portland,_Oregon), and then picked up by the Associated Press. In 1958, the mysterious creature would first be described as "[Bigfoot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bigfoot)" because of the large footprints observed after a sighting in northern California.
The London Reparations Conference opened to arrange for the implementation of the [Dawes Plan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dawes_Plan).
The airmen trying to make the [first aerial circumnavigation of the globe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/First_aerial_circumnavigation) flew from Paris to London.

sources: [The Hairy History of Bigfoot in 20 Intriguing Events](https://historycollection.com/the-hairy-history-of-bigfoot-in-20-intriguing-events/10/) - November 9, 2018

events.text: USS *Barracuda*, [submarine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/submarine) "twice as large as any built previously for the United States Navy", was launched from the [Portsmouth Naval Shipyard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portsmouth_Naval_Shipyard) at [New Hampshire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Hampshire) as the first of the new generation of American subs, the [V-boats](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/V-boat).

Future Hall of Famer[Jesse Haines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jesse_Haines) pitched a [no-hitter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/no-hitter) for the [St. Louis Cardinals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/St._Louis_Cardinals) in a 5–0 win over the [Boston Braves](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_the_Boston_Braves).
